body:
As mentioned in https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/4665#issuecomment-153156285 this game has some weird glitches which seems fixed by disabling slower effects, and appear differently depending if simulate block transfer is used or not. Screenshots made by PPSSPP will usually just make the glitch into completely black square, but they can be transparent gray as well as take shapes of elements they were under when the effect was created, like for example this:
![bsaartifacts](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5485237/10903224/aa9b04e0-8207-11e5-83d2-22b3d1b3cb7e.jpg)
which was created under character and so still has an empty shape of character legs inside.
I copied contents of GEdebugger tabs while looking at that effect here: https://gist.github.com/LunaMoo/8378e6ec0641929cab78
You can see the texture used for this:
![texture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5485237/10903271/3e407af4-8208-11e5-937d-5e3044328489.jpg)
which is the blue frame on a black square, seems that the arrow to the right of it which is also on black square(all colors 0, a = 255) also causes those glitches while other things there are issue free.

 I really have no ideas what could it be, as mentioned disabling slower effects magically causes black/gray squares disappear and it shows normal graphics
![bsaslower effects disabled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5485237/10903366/2493bd36-8209-11e5-9735-fcf62df1d889.jpg)
.

body:
So, hi. I'm Karen/angelXwind, jailbroken iOS developer. This is going to be a rather lengthy post of sorts, detailing into the changes that were made in Pangu9 and such — and how they affect PPSSPP.

Note that I will be skipping out on a bunch of the details as to how Pangu9 (`fuxiqin`) works — simply because I don't think I'm really supposed to say anything about that.

Anyway, you may have noticed that attempting to use PPSSPP's JIT core on an arm64 iOS 9 device will just result in a crash. And you also may have noticed that using any PPSSPP build that isn't from PPSSPPBuildBot (that I run) will... "crash" instantly at launch, no matter what you do.

This is due to a number of changes in both iOS 9 and how Pangu9 works. iOS 9 (and OS X 10.11) includes something Apple advertises as "Rootless Security"

Now, many people think "Rootless" means "there is no longer root on iOS/OSX" — no, that'd be crazy. "Rootless" (on iOS, at least) is actually called KPP — Kernel Patch Protection — something where iOS checksums the kernel *constantly* (ARM TrustZone functionality is how they're doing that without destroying battery life), and panics if anything is patched.

Because of this new security model in iOS, Pangu9 had to make a number of innovations in how the untether works — this is where I skip out on details. The core thing that affects PPSSPP and other projects requiring JIT/modifying of `rwx` memory pages (like my own NO PLS RECOVERY) is the fact that the kernel is no longer patched.

You see, no one's actually figured out how to break KPP. So Pangu9 does not actually patch the kernel, but rather does some [censored] magic to achieve *most* of what we see in past jailbreaks. Unfortunately, `VM_PROTECT` is not one of these things — this is what broke basically every JIT implementation out there.

Now, some of you with iOS 9 32-bit devices (iPhone 5, 5c, 4s; iPad 2, 3, 4; iPod touch 5) may have noticed that hey — PPSSPPBuildBot's PPSSPP builds have perfectly working JIT! This is because Pangu9 on 32-bit devices actually does patch the kernel, including `VM_PROTECT` ;P So JIT is fine for you.

The solution to this issue is something I've already told @hrydgard — you'd need to do some trickery with deallocating/reallocating pages. While `VM_PROTECT` isn't patched, this is (so no, this won't magically make JIT work on non-jailbroken devices).

Basically, you'd have to use `vm_deallocate` and `mmap` (with the `MAP_JIT` flag) in order to perform JIT.

Now, this is something that... *should* work — by that, I mean no one's actually done this/tested this before. So we're headed into uncharted territory here ;P

So that's JIT.

Now, moving onto this crash-at-launch issue that people are experiencing. This one's really simple, actually.

Basically, it's an issue with code-signing. PPSSPP is an unsigned binary, and iOS 9 doesn't like that. We'd need to at least fakesign it via adhoc signing (use `-` code-signing). I have a pull request coming soon that'll fix this issue, but for now PPSSPPBuildBot already does this.

**So what happens now?**

Currently, I'm still terribly busy with school (college applications, notably) — but those will be over in a few days. I plan to submit a pull request that'll do a few things:

1. Modify the `canUseJit` functionality to check to see if PPSSPP is running on **arm64** iOS 9 — if so, the device will be marked as JIT-incapable (but not necessarily unjailbroken). This will fix the vertex shader JIT crash that occurs even if CPU JIT is off. When @hrydgard gets around to modifying the JIT core, this will be removed.

1. Fix the codesigning issue by setting it to use Adhoc codesigning as opposed to no codesigning.
title: arm64 JIT and codesigning on iOS 9

body:
I have been playing Star Wars Battlefront: Elite Squadron, using the latest build for x86, that is v1.1.1-41-g9890460

The game play as good as usual in instant action, you can complete battles without a problem, galactic conquest seems correct too but in the campaign mode, after many missions without a single ppsspp bug (i'm amazed at how good ppsspp display that game with the improved resolution, played for hours without problem) but there's one in which you infiltrate an imperial destroyer, go to its ion canon and use it to destroy the defense on the ground, go back to your x-wing fighter and leave the destroyer with it with troopers are attacking you.

But with PPSSPP, as soon as your x-wing is going to leave the destroyer and the cutscene for it start, PPSSPP seems to go in a huge spam of these in the console 
W[FileSys] FileSystems\ISOFileSystem.cpp:571 Reading beyond end of file, clamping size 32768 to 2020
it's constantly repeating with several lines exactly similar added by seconds

before that line, you have sometime 
Atrac File-C
or
idle0
or
user_main
but after those the W[FileSys] thing is the exact same message

I can reproduce it everytime at that point of the campaign so i guess it's not a random bug, here is the save state if it can help 
https://www.dropbox.com/s/ghn8znsiaaalqa2/bf2efcrash.zip?dl=0

It's for the game in french language, i do not know if that save state can work on other variant
I added the picture in the zip that come with the save state file in case it's needed to load it
title: Star Wars Battlefront: Elite Squadron can freeze PPSSPP at some point

body:
I like to record high resolution gameplay footage regularly and I currently can't do that with the PSP. PPSSPP's internal resolution feature lets me make games look as beautiful as possible and I'd like to be able to save videos with those enhancements. A simple VFW dump-to-avi dialogue would do the trick, I could pick a lossless RGB codec (like Lagarith) and start dumping. Alternatively, FFMPEG would be a good solution too provided a similar solution could be achieved (lossless RGB colorspace dumping).

A lot of emulators have a video dumping option and it's something I really want to see in PPSSPP. 

Thank you for the consideration.
title: Request: Video Dumping

body:
Tested with PPSSPP 1.1.1 on winXP (win32) , it's been a very long time i didn't played it on PPSSPP so i couldn't notice before (but i guess it has to do with the same problem as Final Night Round 3 i reported some time ago.
https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/8004

FIFA10 has missing icons, logos and ingame player arrows missing when playing in D3D9. while when playing in OpenGL it's perfect. Everything else run perfectly in D3D9, it's only those 2D UI elements that aren't displayed

I noticed today on the ppsspp board, someone mentionned the same problem, but with FIFA 14 :
http://forums.ppsspp.org/showthread.php?tid=6645&pid=111395#pid111395

As i guess all those EA FIFA games are using the same engine and so probably UI display tricks, it's very likely the whole FIFA serie has that problem on D3D9 with PPSSPP

If i check in PPSSPP , the code for FIFA10 (the european version, but i guess alll versions are affected) is ULES01326 , no idea unfortunately for the other FIFA games or language variant
title: FIFA serie seems to have some missing UI parts in D3D9

This one is a bit tricky for me to explain, so bear with me. We all know PPSSPP can boot PSP eboots that are contained in a folder (such as /SomeISODirectory/Game/Eboot.pbp), but if you have them in a folder hierarchy like so:

/SomeISODirectory
-----/GameIDHere
-------------/USRDIR/Eboot.PBP (so the full path is /SomeISODirectory/GameIDHere/USRDIR/eboot.pbp)

Then the game is instead recognised as 'save data' and PPSSPP will refuse to boot it.
title: Windows: Games in eboot.pbp format fail to load if they're more than one directory deep

body:
Very early draft of a new way of drawing PSP graphics. Instead of simply running the state machine, where our only way to do clever drawcall optimizations is to add more flags and states, this takes the command stream and bundles it up into self-contained "CommandPackets" which consists of draw calls that point to state blocks.

The division between the state blocks is pretty similar to what we see in the modern GPU APIs. However, the mapping will of course not be 1:1 as we sometimes must use shaders to simulated blend features, and the whole stencil/alpha mess, etc.

But anyway, the fun part is that now we can do optimizations across drawcalls using straight line code without building more and more impossible-to-understand state machines. For example, the water that GTA stupidly draws using 1000 draw calls, each a single polygon with a different transform matrix, can be trivially detected and bundled up into a single draw call, which should greatly improve performance on mobile.

Another fun thing that this enables is to take skinned meshes and convert them to use modern matrix palette techniques, where we upload the entire skeleton at once and skin the whole mesh on the GPU in a single draw call. Our "software skinning" kind of emulated this on the CPU, but it should be possible get it a lot faster.

New forms of caching, and decoding many draw calls into a single big buffer, binding it once and then drawing with much less buffer switching than before also become possible.

Also it becomes very easy to do things like vertex decoding and texture conversion in parallel.

Unfortunately this is only a very early sketch, what has been (mostly) implemented is the drawcall bundling. The actual drawing backends I've only just started on. Another open question is when to split these commandpackets and send them off for drawing.

Hopefully, this will, once finished, lead to much greater 3D performance on platforms with slow OpenGL drivers, like most Android devices.

Also MSVC project files have not yet been updated.
title: RFC: High-level GPU pipeline (early, much work remains)

body:
I was thinking of adding a feature that ran some tests through GL or the backend (not sure the best way, maybe pspautotests style, maybe just GL style...) which could identify problems that certain cards have.

For example, we saw that using a fixed value that was 0xFFFFFF behaved differently than GL_ONE, but we only had reports from GitHub comments to go on for this.

If instead we even just had a button that allowed users to "report graphics compatibility", we could centralize these metrics and see what methods fail for which devices.  Case in point, #1313.  Does this actually fail on all PowerVR devices?  Is it a bug and failing on Mali also, or is it only certain PowerVR devices?  Do we want to send a slew of builds to just one user to find out, even if that one user ends up being on some ancient buggy driver version and it's only affecting them?

But, I'm not sure the best way to architect the graphics tests.  If we do it through PSP code, we get cross-backend testing for free.  However, we also lose the ability to test around our existing compatibility hacks, and we can't test methods we don't currently employ.

-[Unknown]
title: Graphics compatibility feedback?

body:
I'm running debian jessie, with ppsspp-sdl built from source using the v1.0.1 release-tag.

I have xpad blacklisted, and xboxdrv is set with the `mimic-xpad` flag for support with various games running through steam.

I am using an xbox360 wireless controller.

I was able to remap the controls to work in ppsspp games, but they do not work with the ppsspp interface.  Instead my A, B, X, Y buttons are interpretted as dpad, and the dpad is also interpretted as dpad, but there is no confirmation button so I can't navigate the menu purely by controller.

Is there a way to tell ppsspp to use the remapped input for its own interface?
title: linux ppsspp interface not recognizing default xboxdrv/xbox360 keymap

body:
I somehow recall this got reported before, but couldn't find the issue (after a quite brief search). Anyway, got this through e-mail:

"Because I couldn't speak English, so use software will Chinese translated into English, hope you can understand:）

Dear hrydgar：
Blackberry version of the audio driver has a problem：
[1], the system version and the environment: BlackBerry Q5, system: BlackBerry 10.3.1.2267
[2], PPSSPP version: blackberry, 0.9.9.1-1439 (excluding) after all versions, including more than 1.0 have tried
[3], name of the game: all the games.
[4], the problem is link: All the sounds of the game is not smooth , the voice of the game, but it's ok to 1439 version and the previous version
[5], the types of problems: The voice is not smooth
[6], the simulator set changes: use the default Settings, at about 1.0 in this version. A sound set up more options, but check whether or not there is a problem 

中文（原文）：
Blackberry 版本的声音驱动有问题！
1、系统版本与环境：手机黑莓Q5，系统：BlackBerry 10.3.1.2267
2、ppsspp版本：blackberry 版，0.9.9.1-1439（不含）之后全部版本，包括1.0以上都试过
3、游戏名称版本：所有游戏。
4、问题出现环节：所有游戏的声音都出现卡顿，，但1439版及之前的版本没问题
5、问题类型：声音卡顿
6、模拟器设置改动：使用默认的设置，大约在1.0这的版本中。声音设置多了个选项，但不论勾选与否问题都存在
"
title: Audio problems on Blackberry (user-reported) since approx 0.9.9.1-1439

title: Feature request: Add some ad-hoc server address buttons.

body:
PPSSPP version: v1.0.1-558-g268aed4
OS: Windows 7 64-bit
Resolution: 1920x1080
Graphics Card: Nvidia GTX 760
Backend: Open GL (Occurs in DirectX 9 also)
Basically what the title says. When you switch to fullscreen mode with the window size set to 1x, the clickable areas shift out of position from the buttons on screen, so trying to click on a button doesn't seem to work or return the desired result, while clicking at random positions on the screen sometimes triggers a function.
I suspect this may be because when switching to fullscreen in 1x the menu looks like this:
![menu_00000](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5077063/7902773/81b1953a-07cd-11e5-9b09-9a75a009f079.png)
While with any other window size it looks like this:
![menu_00001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5077063/7902774/a9ec3aaa-07cd-11e5-8f63-77f89bbf5f4f.png)
title: Clickable areas become dislocated when switching to Fullscreen Mode in the menu with 1x Window Size

body:
Upon exit of games the respective games don't show up in the recent tab. Only exception to this is PES 2012.
I have a Macbook Air with the latest version of PPSSPPSDL.
title: Recent Tab no longer stores games

body: I played a lot of games on PPSSPP but recently whenever I launch emulator, I get black screen. I can press and even launch games, but no image displayed, only sound.
title: Blackscreen when opening ppsspp

body: I know that screen recording slows down some games but I don't understand why programs like Fraps and Dxtory absolutely wreck PPSSPP's framerate? I run at a solid 60fps most of the time and I have a high-end GPU. I would normally understand this and think that it's just the way the emulator is made BUT if I screenshare through Skype, I stay at about 60fps! I have no idea why dedicated recording software makes PPSSPP lag while 'recording' with Skype makes no difference!
title: Recording gameplay is very slow!

title: PPSSPPSDL crashing after loading iso files

body: On Android, there is an option to forcibly change the screen orientation in Settings→System. This feature is absent on iOS.
title: [iOS] Missing option to force screen rotation to a certain orientation

body:
I run PPSSPP on my Galaxy S2 (I9100).

Multithreaded option doesn't have any effect if it's enabled before you start the game.

The only way to get it working:
1. disable multithreaded,
2. start the game
3. then enable multithreaded.

So enable it only after you started the game. You have to do this everytime when you want to play (disable, start game, enable).
The only work-around is to create a PPSSPP save file after you got it working.

For example you can test this bug with Colin McRae Rally 2005, because the Multithreaded feature makes noticeable difference with this game (on my Galaxy S2 it gives about 20% improvement in speed, combined with my other settings).
title: Problem with 'Multithreaded' feature + workaround

This really isn't an useful feature for anyone other than developers, but it'd be nice to have an OpenGL ES 3/OpenGL ES 2 switcher in the Developer Tools menu so some bugs like #7756 can be tested across both backends.

Note: While the issue title does say iOS, this feature is relevant to Android, too.
title: [iOS] Cannot switch between OpenGL ES 3 and OpenGL ES 2 rendering backends

body:
Under iOS with the OpenGL ES 3 renderer (A7-S5L8960X), many 2D sprites are missing in Kingdom Hearts Birth By Sleep.

This includes (but probably isn't limited to):

* First-time world warp title cards
* Dropped munny/other items from Unversed and other attackable objects

I do not have my Android device with me at the moment, so I cannot test to see if this bug happens on an OGLES3-capable Android device.

The issue is NOT present under OpenGL 2.1 on neither OS X nor Windows.

Screenshots:
Improper behaviour under OpenGL ES 3.0: ![img_6527](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1980487/7739012/247430f0-ff29-11e4-877a-2a7b430a786d.jpg)

Proper behaviour under OpenGL 2.1 (OS X): ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1980487/7739178/0fb9e482-ff2b-11e4-862c-5c5fb25cb448.png)
title: [iOS][OpenGL ES 3][A7-S5L8960X] Some missing 2D sprites in Kingdom Hearts Birth By Sleep (ULJM05600, ULJM05775, ULUS10505)

Even with the clock speed set to auto (0)

Can someone else try it out?
title: Tekken 6 is not booting

body:
The title says it all  , i woke up this morning and my controller no longer works with ppsspp but it works with my other apps. This issue efftects both Qt and SDL versions in the stable and unstable ppas.

I'm not sure what information you need  but i am using Ubuntu 14.10 64 bit;  kernel version 3.16.0-34-generic and the package version installed is 1.0.1+r52.f46.n1177.l1577.a156~15~ubuntu14.10.1.


please let me know if i can provide more information or if this is not where to report what appears to be a bug
title: Controller no longer works in linux

body: When the game opens and the opening video starts to play, there is no sound and the log console is spammed with Failed to decode audio messages

body:
I've been trying those two games and both run smoothly at 60FPS either on my PC and Android phone. However certain game actions (or keypresses?) make the framerate drop to about 30FPS and 50% speed, making the games almost unplayable even with a high frameskip. Everytime I roll or everytime I grab onto a ledge AND then try to move laterally this happens (in both games and platforms). Might happen with other actions too. Jumping, shooting and using grappling hook seemed ok. 
The strange thing is that no matter what you do, the game will run at 50% speed even after rolling or climbing action is finished. However I noticed that triggering an ingame cutscene solves the issue until one of the actions above is done again. Graphics and other settings doesn't seem to solve or mitigate the problem at all, the game runs approximately at the same speed and FPS with both "low" or "high" settings.
I would have attached a log but it seems no errors or warnings are generated when the issue araises. The errors reported were logged way before or after the mentioned events, so I'm not sure this would be useful

body:
Meaning problems got help by changing I/O timing method to "HOST" or"Simulate UMD delays".

"Simulate UMD delays" helps the following games
- Innocent Life https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/2830
- Dan Ball Senki W https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/4786
- Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 3 with Izayoiki Aizouban https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/6127
- DJMAX Portable 2 https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/5837 ,probably also helps other DJMAX games.
- Super Robot Taisen OG Saga: Masou Kishin II https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/5540
- Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Portable https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/6557
- Gran Turismo https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/6189
- Crash: Mind Over Mutant https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/7645
- Tengai Makyou - Daishi no Mokushiroku (hangs on certain scene)
- Pangya: Fantasy Golf https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/4996

"Host" helps the following games
- Ace Combat X2 Joint Assault https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/5545

"Simulate UMD delays" breaks the following games
- Radiant mythology2 (hang)
- Ghost in the shell (hang)
- Race Driver 2006 (hang) https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/7425
- world neverland (slow)

Saved State = État sauvegardé !

body:
The atari 800 emulator:
http://psp.akop.org/atari800
download here: http://psp.akop.org/atari800/download/2.1.0.1/1.00

Is running, but it seems to choke ~every second - goes about 1 sec fullspeed, and then locks up for another 1 sec on Android (tested on Xperia Play and a LG G3) as well as the PC build (latest git version).

The slowest/ most active syscall is: sceGeListUpdateStallAddr, which takes ~0.90 ms to complete when it's frozen (on PC, similar on adroid).

The reasons I'm asking about this at all are:
1. Although there IS a free android atari 800 emu, this one seems to actually run better than the native one, even on the xplay! When it's not freezing of course.
2. There is no atari 800 emulator on IOS, and this could serve as a very good alternative.

What do you think? And how can I help track the problem?
title: Atari 800 emulator freezes every 1 second on Android and PC

body:
Ok, so recently I've been running PPSSP's linux version, on the AMD open source driver on Linux Mint 17.1.  The proprietary driver screws up my hdtv's resolution support something fierce, so I don't use that.

For the most part, it works fine, except the current profile is apparantly a compatibility context which limits us to Opengl 3.0 and shading language 1.30 support, as seen here:
![gallium info](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7368696/6545042/a02b64aa-c524-11e4-95d2-8bf366d01037.png)

This prevents us from using stuff like Asmodean's shaders that are in the custom ppsspp shaders thread:
![glsl error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7368696/6545045/d64e9598-c524-11e4-81ce-980455a9cb09.png)

Anyway, in searching for a non-proprietary driver solution, I came across this thread, whereupon they seem to be managing to initialize the open source driver with full OpenGL 3.3 and shading language 1.50 support:  https://github.com/RobertBeckebans/RBDOOM-3-BFG/issues/137

I don't know if what they did is trivial enough to be adapted to PPSSPP for linux' case easily, but I would think that getting a little more power out of the same driver might be something you guys would be interested in.
title: [Feature Request] OpenGL 3.3 core profile support on AMD open source driver?

body:
Hello,

I have an issue with the DS4 controller on my system with PPSSPP when trying to navigate the Pause menu.  The dualshock 4's d-pad is recognized as a hat switch (which it is) and works fine, but the face buttons are recognized as Left/Right/Down/Up.

This isn't an issue when playing the game itself, but it becomes a problem when trying to navigate the pause menu, as the buttons are not being interpreted properly, so they just end up controlling directional buttons instead.

I'm not sure if this is a problem with the controllers on OS X or what the actual issue is, but I'm wondering if there would be an easy way to rectify this.  I was thinking if there was a separate section to bind inputs to the actual menu inputs that this could fix the problem?

I know that currently you are mapping what is supposed to be the Circle and Cross buttons to these inputs already, but because my values are coming back as 18-21, there isn't any way for me to override this without breaking other input support.

Is this something that should be looked into?  Or should I just create my own fix?  
I run OS X 10.10.2 (Yosemite), I've tried using both the DS4 and the DS3 and the DS3 still doesn't map the buttons properly either.

Sorry for this mess of an issue, I hope you understand what I'm trying to convey here.
title: Controller can't navigate the menu properly (OS X)

body:
Hey there. For some time now there's something that is bothering me about this game on PPSSPP. Is not a thing that gets in the way of the gameplay (as in you can play fine), but I find it kinda interesting so I wanted to share it with you.

For some time now I have noticed that on the bottom of the game screen there is a line that appears as you can see on the following screenshots:

![digimonadventureline](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6118529/6168927/20b9139a-b28f-11e4-8f67-d5d2c558b7c8.jpg)

![digimonadventureline2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6118529/6168928/20ba6ace-b28f-11e4-901f-4a9d13d610be.jpg)

This happens if you set the window size on x2 size or up with the rendering size set in auto, but I also tried to put the rendering set manual, as in windows size x2 and rendering size 2 which is same window resolution and internal resolution. On the videos the line is more noticeable as you can see on the first screenshot which is from Gatomon's warp digivolve sequence video (or FMV? I don't know which format they are n.nU), while on gameplay the line is seen only at certain positions. I mean when you have the character standing or moving on certain spots, usually when the camera makes a closer look (not full close up but that the characters look big due to the close view from the camera)

The only time that line doesn't appears is if you use de Windows size x1 and rendering size in auto or 1 and even so the line appears on windows size x1 and rendering size auto after you load your save file or start a new game and you see the intro (the characters outside of that small house they took cover from the snow) and you have to move the rendering size or go to full screen and return for that line to desappear (videos included), but it only works for windows size x1

I remember that on a previous issue (the one about the characters outlines that got solved with the block transfer option) this line had to do with the buffer size or something like that.

The line appears on both backends OpenGL and Direct3D9

I thought in open an issue so at least we can have a progress log for it. There's no hurry since it doesn't affects the gameplay at all, but I found interesting that this line appears at the bottom of the game screen. I attached a third screenshot below. This one is from a previous build of PPSSP after the outlines issue got fixed, but it works for this issue. The screenshots above are with the latest PPSSPP build from buildbot.

Thanks in advance  :)

![screen6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6118529/6169145/253fb052-b291-11e4-9d43-fb616f9e6196.png)

Extra info: The line on gameplay (as in when you can move the character) only appears if simulate block transfer is enabled. When this setting is disabled that line doesn't appears for gameplay, but it does appears for videos even with the block transfer setting disabled. This means that we have 2 different issues. One is the line on gameplay which seems to be related to simulate block transfer, and the line on de videos (digivolutions, some scenes, the Adventure anime opening) the game includes. Oddly enough both issues disappear in windows size x1 and rendering size 1 after a few tries. this not being the same for the rest of rendering size and windows sizes.
title: Digimon Adventure PSP NPJH-50686 line visible on the bottom of the game's screen

body:
Just some ideas:

1. When alpha blending is disabled, force it on when the test is != 0 or > anything.  Better than off.

2. As long as alpha blending is/can be set to something standard, set the alpha channel to 0 instead of discarding.  This would affect stencil/depth, but be better than the existing hack of drawing it with e.g. partial alpha.

3. As long as alpha blending is/can be set to something standard, set the alpha channel to 1 when the test passes (e.g. if > 0 but < 1 and test is > 0... but also some games use == 0 tests, which could be optimized this way.)

   Note that doing such things would not actually write an incorrect value to the alpha channel of the framebuffer, necessarily, since it should correctly write the stencil value anyway.  Potentially this could be a safe optimization and not a speedhack (when depth write is off and stencil testing is KEEP/off.)

4. We could have a "middle ground" option that disables alpha testing only for the more common cases / types, but keeps it for uncommon ones.  This could still offer the speed improvements without affecting small graphics or effects that need more complicated tests / blending.

5. We could try passing through writes using GL_EXT_shader_framebuffer_fetch (where available.)  This would have incorrect depth and stencil handling, but it would be better than existing.

-[Unknown]
title: Possible improvements to disable alpha test speedhack

body:
Simply put, this game has a paradoxal Adhoc bug.
While the game joins the Host's Lobby, a pop up window that is supposed to show before said Host Lobby is shown at the same exact time and it never goes away, even worse it makes all controls unresponsive. This pop up window is supposed to just flash on screen for a while and then disappear, only then the Host's Lobby is supposed to appear afterwards. Like in this video: http://youtu.be/tf7zM20Jue0 (around 0:20)

This is not what happens, both windows appear at the same exact time (paradox) and since the pop up window at the center takes priority over all the other windows, it blocks all the buttons from working, making the game stuck and a PPSSPP reset the only remaining option. Note the game is actually hosting fine and other playes can even join in, it's just this pop up window of hell at the center that gets in the way and makes everything unresponsive and stuck forever.

Now comes the really weird part, JPCSP does the exact same thing when trying to connect to coldbird.net just like in PPSSPP. However, setting JPCSP's clock to 150% actually fixes the pop up window of hell and the game works online just fine if you set the clock back to normal (see SS below).
I had my hopes up and went to do some testing with PPSSPP, but it did not work. Even setting an alternate speed of a MAX 600% the pop up did not go away like JPCSP.

I'm only posting this issue because it "seems" an easy fix (hopefully), maybe some bad timing in the call of a thread or an ant that got somewhere in the code, i don't know.

150% clock speed JPCSP fix, all the buttons are responsive and the game can be started by pressing O
![fix1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10441372/6091329/6f5469aa-ae8e-11e4-8984-b21f3a21668f.png)

PPSSPP with the above fix (alternate speed to 150%), buttons still unresponsive
![uljs00266_00001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10441372/6091346/d0774572-ae8e-11e4-90ae-97e96c672727.jpg)

Log doesn't show any Errors either (apart from sceMpeg), just warnings:
![hackparadox](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10441372/6091399/2d264456-ae91-11e4-85d7-5f7645bdf005.png)
title: Adhoc - hack//LINK window pop up paradox

body:
The auto assembler within the debugger will always compile to a 'j' when specifying the branch always instruction 'b'.

Example Line:
```
0889E590 bne s0,zero,0x0889E5C8 (Instruction Bytes: 1600000D)
```

Auto Assemble:
```
b 0x0889E5C8 (Instruction Bytes: 1000000D)
```

Result:
```
j 0x0889E5C8 (Instruction Bytes: 0A227972)
```

They do relatively the same action, but it should be compiling to 1600000D instead of 0A227972 when specifying a 'b' instruction.
title: Auto Assemble Error (Debugger)

body:
An option (on/off toggle found on the debugger) to create a text file that will log all assembly execution (w/ optional registers display) up until the option is toggled off. You should be have the ability to alter the file name of the output file from within the gui. Output format per line would be:

[Address]   [Instruction Bytes]  [Instruction Literal]  [Optional Register Display]

Example:

```
...
0882BA94  00808825  move s1,a0     {Optional Register Display Here}
0882BA98  00408025  move s0,v0     {Optional Register Display Here}
0882BA9C  3C040003  lui  a0,0x3    {Optional Register Display Here}
...
```

This feature would be very beneficial to hackers as they can manually back trace through the log along the game's execution path in reverse from a breakpoint location with ease. Trace logs can also be compared to show differences in execution path between them, which is very useful for exposing harder to find hacks that are based on random chance.
title: [Request] Trace Log Implementation

We need code locking interval option for the codes part.

This option is A MUST HAVE for the Cheats menu.
It will allow us to change code locking interval "cheat hz" so games can not change values by themselves once a code is activated.

Currently PPSSPP Cheat's engine doesn't freeze the codes the way it should be and the game changes values itself even if a code is activated thus leading to crashes/not working codes.

But my main problems are the first two.
I need a code locking interval option for the cheats. This will be a great service and huge upgrade to the emu. Thank you. Many people ask for this and I personally want this as I am a game mods dev too.

"

body:
Not very sure (tested on the disassembled and modified game), but in some cases PPSSPP seems to behave differently from the real system on memory read ops. It's not actually a bug (it allows to play some faulty games), but it can be useful for debugging.

Example:
In the following memory chunk, read the 4-byte at +0x06
00 | 00 | 00 | 00 | 00 | 00 | 54 | 01 | 00 | 00 | 00 | 00 | 00 | 00 | 00 | 00
PPSSPP's result is 0x00000154, while PSP's (and JPCSP's) result'll be 0x01540000
title: Memory alignment check

Since official ppsspp 0.9.9.1 was working great, it's been a "long" time that I didn't try another build, so when I installed 0.9.9.1-1498 on my Android tablet device (Asus ME173X - quad core 1.2 - PowerVR SGX 544MP) I was almost "shocked" to see that the emulator had become so slow.
Where it was at 30 fps with 9.9.1, now using 9.9.1-1498 is at around 25 fps (almost 20% speed loss)...so I began to track down what revision caused this problem and found out that 0.9.9.1-54 is the last available build with the great "old" speed, while starting with 9.9.1-65  begins (my?) Android slowness problems (Windows 8.1 64bit version doesn't seem to be affected)

So one of these commits should be responsible for this problem (unfortunately there are no builds about them to test):

body:
Moga on PPSSPP in Linux (ppsspp-sdl, can't get ppsspp-qt to recognize anything) is flippin' crazy.  Where to start?

As stated in the 1.0 regressions thread, Mode A is not seen as a joypad, but rather a phone/computer in linux mint, so I use mode B, pairing code 1234.  In game nearly all button/triggers work as designed once I remap them, better than windows (can't use triggers on windows, moga company devs are apparently not motivated enough to release proper driver support)!

However, the default guesses for button assignements are way off, and that's partly due to what linux is calling the buttons.  I've attached some screenshots below of my corrected control mapping, and they reveal some non-sensical button names, particularly for the A/B/X/Y buttons and Select/Back.  I don't know if this is the OSes fault or if key codes are being misunderstood, but sometimes select doesn't work in game, also.  And yes, my control mapping has the dpad mapped to both the controller's dpad and the right analog (in that order as seen on the screenshots) for more natural camera control purposes, as well as L and R being mapped to the triggers instead of the bumpers.

In-ui is where the most of the bugs are.  A/B/X/Y buttons are acting like a copy of the dpad, and even then, the dpad buttons are not navigating the ui correctly at all, especially in submenus like Settings.  Up is acting like Enter, Down is acting like ESC.  Left and Right seem mostly right.  A and B are not acting like Cancel/Confirm like they should be.

![screenshot from 2015-01-08 21 38 06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7368696/5675933/d2bcc328-977f-11e4-898f-faf89dad67c7.png)
![screenshot from 2015-01-08 21 38 16](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7368696/5675932/d2bca082-977f-11e4-8c05-9687db186d56.png)
![screenshot from 2015-01-08 21 38 33](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7368696/5675934/d2bd645e-977f-11e4-95a2-3fdb770bd71b.png)

body:
Currently, to play adhoc multiplayer in many games you have to forward ports and stuff, and follow complicated guides that people have written in the forum. It would be good to simplify this. Using the original ports is of course necessary if you want to play against a real PSP, but having the option to avoid much of the hassle would be nice.

Also I think there's more in the networking setup that can be automated, but I haven't really looked into it much yet.
title: Tunnel adhoc traffic through a single port - possible?

body:
Hi, PPSSPP developers,
Recently I bought a Xbox style gamepad and successfully pairing it to my Android device.
I could map every button in PPSSPP, but found minor issue.

In my device, PPSSPP recognize **SELECT** button as **BACK** button from Android. Although I can map this button, but PPSSPP still recognize it as **BACK** button, therefore when I press the button it will execute two functions: As **SELECT** button and for showing PPSSPP pause menu. It isn't comfort to always return to the game everytime I need to press **SELECT** button.

I really hope you want to fix this issue before 1.0 release by ignoring every Android function that already mapped in PPSSPP. In ePSXe this is possible, and I hope PPSSPP also.

*Best regards,
RyanBram*
title: Physical mapped button has double function

body:
Since the arrival of brand new 900 series of Nvidia graphic cards, there's a new technology avaible for all of us: Dynamic Super Resolution, known as DSR.

Basically DSR technology allows to use up to 4K resolution under a native 1080p display, as a result you will have better graphics experience.

Actually can't handle DSR because it detects native display resolution and we could only use this one on fullscreen.

For example, Dolphin can handle this, because you can choose fullscreen resolution. Here Nvidia "fakes" native resolution up to 4K, and the rescaling it to real native resolution. Even more, under opengl/d3d ini config file you can enable "custom" internal resolution.

So, is there any way to implement this to PPSSPP? If you need tester I could be one :).

Regards.
title: [Feature Request] Allow Nvidia DSR technology

body:
Hi, PPSSPP Developers,
This is my first time submitting issue for PPSSPP.

I tried PPSSPP for many games from resource hungry games such as Warriors Orochi series until simple 2D games such as Tales of Eternia. Generally all of the game that I tried is playable without major issues. The only thing that I found is generally PPSSPP will run very slow when I am playing 2D titles, such as Tales of Eternia and Harvest Moon Boy & Girl even with frameskip activated. This issue not appear if I am playing 3D title, such as Warriors Orochi or Final Fantasy III.

I tried any setting that I knew, but no big difference in performance.

--
*Windows 7 - 64 bit
PPSSPP 0.9.9.1
Intel Core i3 2350M Sandy Bridge
Intel(R) HD Graphics Family GT2
500 GB HDD
6 GB of RAM*
title: 2D Games Tends to Slow

body:
I've been fiddling with the idea of using heuristics to identify rendering operations that are drawing 2D bitmaps, text, etc. For the game I've been playing - The 3rd Birthday - this is a huge improvement to legibility for the UI and eliminates some gross artifacts (like a green blurry halo on some title screen text), without sacrificing filtering for the 3D scene or for post-processing effects.

My main question is whether there are some key games that it would be worth testing this heuristic against, and whether this seems like an approach that could be adopted for PPSSPP. It's not a game-specific heuristic but I'm uncertain whether it would be possible to make this heuristic work correctly for all games.

You can see my current swing at the heuristic here:
https://github.com/kg/ppsspp/commit/dc78745d5a902088112975bbcb5ea50a5708d4aa

And I'm attaching some comparison screenshots from the game I'm testing on (Nearest, Linear, and the new 'Hybrid' heuristic mode). You may want to view them full size to be able to see some of the differences.

Scene 1, Linear filtering:
![scene1_linear](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/198130/5560249/b27af20a-8d30-11e4-9ba0-dd3ceab79d06.jpg)
Scene 1, Nearest filtering:
![scene1_nearest](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/198130/5560252/b27f526e-8d30-11e4-9245-5e01338e3885.jpg)
Scene 1, Hybrid filtering:
![scene1_hybrid](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/198130/5560250/b27bd9f4-8d30-11e4-82d4-9bb3e3cd2cea.jpg)

In scene 1 the environment looks universally better with filtering enabled, but the UI text gets muddy and you see some artifacts - the most obvious one is on the radar, where seams appear. With filtering disabled the UI looks much closer to how it should, but the environment looks awful and the post-processing gets really grainy. Hybrid appears to use the ideal filtering mode for every element in this scene. The post-processing halo around Aya and other characters also looks much better with filtering enabled - in some scenes it's horribly grainy and distracting without filtering. (This halo is basically invisible when running at 1x native PSP resolution - it's their attempt at a bloom filter, I believe.)

Scene 2, Linear filtering:
![scene2_linear](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/198130/5560251/b27e4b1c-8d30-11e4-99f6-24be9addf4bb.jpg)
Scene 2, Nearest filtering:
![scene2_nearest](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/198130/5560253/b27f832e-8d30-11e4-9823-49a82fc2e4fa.jpg)
Scene 2, Hybrid filtering:
![scene2_hybrid](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/198130/5560248/b278e8ac-8d30-11e4-82ff-97d7b4e8468d.jpg)

Things here are similar to scene 1. Of note is that the halos on the lamps look especially bad with nearest filtering, while linear looks much better.

Finally, a comparison for the mission select menu. Nearest was left out because it's equivalent to Hybrid for this menu.

Menu, Linear filtering:
![menu_linear](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/198130/5560280/ea5ca604-8d31-11e4-8de9-9878de454daf.jpg)
Menu, Hybrid filtering:
![menu_hybrid](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/198130/5560279/ea584578-8d31-11e4-9ce7-518678631326.jpg)

For the menu you can see there are obvious filtering seams in various places, because many of the UI elements are cobbled together out of smaller pieces. In general the linear filtering makes the text blurrier and a little harder to read (in my opinion, at least). There are also some nasty artifacts at the edges of some of the bitmaps in Linear mode, for example the 'OE', 'Weapon Lv', and 'Weapons' tabs on the right - presumably from sampling outside the texture rectangle.

Feedback appreciated. I'm going to be using this for the rest of my playthrough to see if there are any problems I've overlooked for this game.
title: Texture filtering heuristic to eliminate 2D artifacts

body:
Ever since this game was able to work without severe graphical glitches, it seems as if it crashes after less than a minute of gameplay (or in the case of Story Mode, the in-engine opening cutscenes if you don't skip them fast enough). The latest build I tried this on was 0.9.9.1-1061 on Windows 7 x64, but this issue had occurred for me ever since the 0.9.8 stable release, so I'm sure the newer builds have it too. With the default settings, the entire emulator crashes to desktop without a warning. With all the "unstable" and "experimental" features turned off, the game just gives a black screen and I'm able to exit into the main emulator menu.

Here's the log file after the black screen:

![ppsspp log](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6110397/5520475/7496d3a2-8950-11e4-9676-f482952bab07.png)
title: Tony Hawk's Underground 2 Remix: Crash after a few seconds of gameplay (0.9.9.1-1061, Windows)

body:
I'm not sure if there is a solution to this.

A very clear example can be seen in Star Ocean, at the SQUARE ENIX logo.  This logo is a 4-bit clut texture, and uses transparent green as its background color.  In OpenGL, it works properly, but in Direct3D there's a green glow around it.

In this case, the texture is 256x256, and it's being drawn in through mode with coordinates exactly 256x256 apart.  So, the maginification/minification is 1:1.

The game, for whatever reason, sets the both min and mag to linear.  Changing mag to nearest solves the issue, so Direct3D seems to consider the texture as being magnified.  Somehow sounds similar to #6077, but in this case both min and mag are linear.

It's not using any testing whatsoever.  It is only using alpha blending to get rid of the green, because all green texture values are fully transparent.

-[Unknown]
title: Direct3D 9: linear filtering applied too often

Does not seem to affect performance much if at all, at the moment.

Tested on ARM and x86/x64. Want this in before I start working on the ARM64 JIT.

body:
Just my todo list for minor JIT inefficiencies discovered when browsing the jit viewer on the train...

  * mtc1 zero, f12 doesn't generate optimal code
  * Sort sequences of sw r2, 12(sp); sw r1, 8(sp); sw r0, 4(sp)    (will allow LDMIA/STDMIA)
  * x86-32 JIT also needs "map-reg-as-address" to avoid repeatedly masking addresses in such cases

body:
This game requires the features "remove memorystick" and "insert memorystick".
![05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3481559/4524415/241561b6-4d44-11e4-8a7d-7eb63a9dc88e.png)

On PSP with 660pro-c2 you can go ingame by doing this.
Enable Inferno & NP9660 Use ISO Cache,and then follow the game's requset: "remove memorystick",press circle,and then"insert memorystick".
title: "Rewrite" can't go ingame.

body: On iPhone 6 and iPhone Plus, reportedly we are getting scaled "the compatibility way" instead of adapting properly to the resolution. We probably just need to set some metadata to mark us as big-screen-aware, as we can already adapt to any resolution.
title: iOS larger screen support

body: What Can I do  to help make this work? I would kill to have ppsspp on my surface and I know about 10000 other people would love it.

body:
Android: phablet Pantech Sky A890 with Quad-Core Qualcomm 800 and 3GB of RAM, 1080P screen.

Lag occur more often when the ball is near goal or when many players come in the scene.

Is there any settings to solve this or is it incomplete implement in emulator for Android?
title: PES 2014 laggy

body: ![06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3481559/4347704/0858e550-4165-11e4-887f-65510487b67f.png) if you go to setting page and go back,or change rendering mode,the subtitle would be seen and disappearing soon,like the video showing https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w3_rDlSmGRc To run this game you have to comment out _dbg_assert_msg_(SCEKERNEL, false, "ThreadQueueList should not be empty."); in sceKernelThread.cpp. softwareGPU works fine ![07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3481559/4347822/fda85bd4-416b-11e4-82fb-4b57485ba274.png) Gedebugger in softwareGPU ![01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3481559/4348262/eab69f46-4183-11e4-95b6-bac447cf34cc.png) then step prim ![02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3481559/4348261/eaafbe42-4183-11e4-91e6-172161455e31.png)
title: Tales of Phantasia Chinese patch doesn't display subtitle in the talking by pressing select button

body: 1. Lag / long start-up problem I noticed a random intensity lag in-game when playing Quake 2 port by CROW_BAR everytime I start it. The lag has a very big variation range from very little to unplayable. The lag intensity changes with every start-up and doesn't seam to change while playing. If the game starts with the second or third demo, PPSSPP OSK will freeze for about 2 minutes while WinUI is still responsive. If you add the music files it will start playing, well sort of, see second problem, long before it actually finishes loading. After second or third demo finally loads the lag is always going to be unplayable severe. So you can get to play after a few tries (I'd say between 1 and 7). The game has to play the first demo and to have low lag. 2. Music distortion There is a music playback issue as well. It is distorted so badly that it doesn't worth adding the music files. According to the log it keeps attempting to resample the music tracks to 44100Hz although I have the music in that sample rate. Video showing both issues: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=me868bf5mHk i got the second demo to load right at the video start. Log screenshot showing music resampling attempts: ![quake2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1138235/4169713/669700da-352a-11e4-9ad2-a5cf122890a5.png)

body:
Hi, I found a few issues in brave story (hardware graphics) and debugged them to varying degrees.
In order of most to least simple to fix / likely to be fixed:

1) Smoke & fire are colored oddly with hardware graphics (also see https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/6332).
From debugging, it looks like the smoke primitives contain various color data and the GE's shademodel is set to GE_SHADE_FLAT.
The software renderer appears to check for the value of shademodel and ignore all but the first color in this case, resulting in the correct image.
However, it looks like no other renderers check shademodel, likely resulting in the colorful smoke.
This should be easy for a dev to fix, I think.   (NOW FIXED)

2) Enemy colors don't always differ in hardware graphics: (Notice color of right bunny in below screenshot in software vs hardware)
From debugging, it looks like brave story sets the framebuffer to the clut area (with inappropriate framebuffer height) and draws colors into it. It then uses the clut for drawing the texture.
In software, you can see that the clut area in memory gets updated between the first and second rabbit.
In hardware, you can see that the clut area in memory doesn't get updated in this case.
(I'm not sure how it's updated at all in hardware, to be honest)

3) With vertex cache set (which is the default), there is serious flickering in the worldmap. Perhaps vertex cache shouldn't be enabled by default until it's more reliable?

screens of bug 1 & 2:
Hardware:
![hardware](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8498306/3976241/704084a0-281c-11e4-99e9-24e943fe32e6.png)
Software: (no bug)
![software](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8498306/3976239/55c2b54e-281c-11e4-9ffb-4ddb6746ff1d.png)
title: Brave story - graphics glitches (debugged)

body:
**Update:-** Tekken 6 is also affected [(see below)](https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/6748#issuecomment-52633796)

First responsible commit via bisecting is v0.9.9-100-g99d9621 https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/commit/99d96218e1906ba020add93c0b0063bf9d434d34 from the https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/pull/6616 pull request by @unknownbrackets 

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3966455/56768444-27a3-11e4-8f56-7df2efb0798e.PNG)

Last unaffected commit from that pull request (https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/pull/6616) is v0.9.9-99-gcf4b607

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3966558/69464860-27a4-11e4-8c27-bccd153284b0.JPG)

**Issue reproduction:-**

1. Start up the game using any version of PPSSPP from v0.9.9.1-38-g2de6b47 onwards using default settings. (v0.9.9.1-38-g2de6b47 is when the afflicted commit got merged to master)

2. Start a New Game (or load an exisiting savefile) and head to Quick Match.

3. Pick any character and opponent. 

4. When the loading screen featuring your selections pops up, the game will just hang at that screen with some flashing numbers at the bottom.

**Screenshot demonstration of the issue:-**

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3966322/de40367e-27a1-11e4-833e-4a0a6b04166a.JPG)

**Debug logfile:-**
![ppsspplogsc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3966511/dfcb7e84-27a3-11e4-8d2c-505c27248e14.jpg)
(rename jpg to 7z and unzip using 7zip)

[Thanks to @twinaphex for the initial discovery.](https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/commit/2de6b471ce545574984cf70e8762fc6a79c48c39#commitcomment-7438364)
title: Soul Calibur Broken Destiny (ULUS10457):- Game hangs at the Quick Match loading screen with some flashing numbers at the bottom since 99d9621 (Update:- Tekken 6 is also affected)

body:
(**Note**:- This is a completely seperate issue to https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/6682 which has a different point of origin)

First responsible commit found via bisecting is **v0.9.7.2-154-gd7ba8f7** https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/commit/d7ba8f7312875cfcff725dc658bbd4732a4b6166

![pangyabisect](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3965616/1ff7a100-2799-11e4-8a58-b3a4a686aa70.PNG)

**Video demonstration of the issue using v0.9.9.1-38-g2de6b47:-**

https://www.mediafire.com/?75752ly55rrqlq9

(Cecilia (player character) moves first, and then Bob (the AI rival) moves next. Skip to 00.14 to see the AI bit right away.)

**Save data for issue reproduction:-**

![ulus10438datc00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3791776/d80adcb4-1b53-11e4-8474-f3c6af5197af.jpg)

(rename jpg to 7z and unzip using 7zip)

**Issue reproduction:-**

a. Start the game using any revision from v0.9.7.2-154-gd7ba8f7 onwards with both Function Replacements and Fast Memory disabled, else the issue reprodcution will be impossible. All other settings can be left to the defaults.

(Loading up the specific matchup will crash the game and the emulator if those two options are not disabled, this is yet another seperate issue with the game and not the focus of this particular issue report.)

b. Load the provided save file.

c. Head to Story Mode, Episode 1, pick Cecilia (lady with the blonde hair) and then choose the 5th event.

d. Once you're into the match proper (skip the dialogue by hammering the Start button), just hit the ball anywhere you wish. (You will start first, press X to gain power, and X again to hit the ball)

e. When the it's the AI's turn (Bob) notice that he is semi-transparent (ghostly looking) and in a rather strange pose. The character does not visibly hit the ball, but eventually some sound effects are heard, and the ball flies off into the distance anyway. When the ball lands, it produces an incorrect out of bounds sound effect regardless of the actual ball position.

**Screenshot comparison:-**

Abnormal AI pose/behaviour/appearance

![panygabobproblem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3965745/7b1d020e-279a-11e4-908f-6e50d0c6f013.JPG)

Normal AI pose/behaviour/appearance

![panygabobokay](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3965746/7dfac790-279a-11e4-83db-9c9353db0db2.JPG)

**Additional Note:-** Obtaining any form of logfile for this issue proved to be impossible; the game/emulator would lock up during a Loading screen in Logging Mode (Debug or otherwise) before the issue even occurs.

Thanks to Kordosa from the ppsspp.org forums for bringing the matter to my attention.
title: Pangya Fantasy Golf (ULUS10438):- Incorrect AI character behaviour/appearance during a particular match up in Story Mode since v0.9.7.2-154-gd7ba8f7

body:
First actual responsible commit was almost impossible to obtain due to the highly randomized nature of the issue, but it roughly begins from 0.9.8-1000 onwards with the introduction of Simulate Block Transfers/Function Replacements.

I couldn't get it to happen on 0.9.8-900 and below. 

Short video showing the spreading white light phenomenon obtained using the latest master:-
(rename jpg to mp4)
![ys seven](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3953934/c90733ae-26f0-11e4-8ef6-6fb7726a8c89.jpg)

Save file for reproduction (rename jpg to 7z and unzip using 7zip):-
![ulus105510004](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3953534/e892c1ce-26ec-11e4-84e1-b318ec0bd99c.jpg)

Reproduction method (highly speculative, since it seems to be a randomly occuring phenomenon):-
(Warning:- WIll/May involve temporary whole system lockups)

1. Start any version of PPSSPP (roughly from 0.9.9 onwards) with default settings.

2. Boot up Ys Seven, and load the provided savefile.

3. If the phenomenon does not occur after a short while (which wil almost entirely be the case during the first boot of the game), close the game (Ctrl-W) and boot it up again. It may take up to 10 reboots to get the issue to appear.

4. When the phenomenon occurs, the light source from the upper middle potion of the screen will spread throughout the entire screen, turning it blinding white. It does not obscure the HUD elements, however.

5. If you then continue waiting at that screen, the emulator will eventually lock up, and the whole system with it, causing it to be completely unresponsive, which ultimately (after 30 seconds of nervous waiting and Ctrl-Alt -Deleting) pops up a "Wait for Emuthread" error, followed by an emulator crash.

Screenshot comparison:-

Problematic:-
![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3953225/8b06ab22-26e9-11e4-8a80-28b984b014f7.JPG)

Normal:-
![ys7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3953112/847f1c36-26e8-11e4-9314-4b4b1fcd9394.JPG)

Stacktrace from MSVC 2013:-
Could not be obtained since the issue never appears while debugging using MSVC 2013.

body:
Please replace this title with a better one!

I've been doing some investigation of why FFT:WOTL is stuck at the host/join menu for ad hoc play. The proximal cause seemed to be that the joining client sent the wrong group ID to the ad hoc server, as witnessed by this log (10.0.1.12 is the hosting player, and 127.0.0.1 is the joining player):
```
New Connection from 10.0.1.12.
PPSSPP (MAC: 9D:99:FB:C8:BB:40 - IP: 10.0.1.12) started playing ULUS10297.
PPSSPP (MAC: 9D:99:FB:C8:BB:40 - IP: 10.0.1.12) joined ULUS10297 group c8bb40cb.
New Connection from 127.0.0.1.
PPSSPP (MAC: AB:C3:B3:8F:BF:D7 - IP: 127.0.0.1) started playing ULUS10297.
PPSSPP (MAC: AB:C3:B3:8F:BF:D7 - IP: 127.0.0.1) requested information on 1 ULUS10297 groups.
PPSSPP (MAC: AB:C3:B3:8F:BF:D7 - IP: 127.0.0.1) attempted to join invalid ULUS10297 group 40cb????.
PPSSPP (MAC: AB:C3:B3:8F:BF:D7 - IP: 127.0.0.1) stopped playing ULUS10297.
PPSSPP (MAC: 9D:99:FB:C8:BB:40 - IP: 10.0.1.12) left ULUS10297 group c8bb40cb.
PPSSPP (MAC: 9D:99:FB:C8:BB:40 - IP: 10.0.1.12) stopped playing ULUS10297.
```
Note the "attempted to join invalid group" shows a group name which is offset to the left by four bytes. Indeed, in `sceNetAdhocctlJoin`, I placed some logging to determine whether the joining client was sending the wrong type of packet or something; as it turns out, interpreting the `scanInfoAddr` argument as a `SceNetAdhocctlScanInfo` immediately places the `group_name` four bytes later than it should be. So, either the `SceNetAdhocctlScanInfo` structure is four bytes smaller in memory on the PSP than expected, or the address being passed to that function was four bytes ahead of where it should have been.

I don't know where the PSP side of the world _gets_ the address that it passes to `sceNetAdhocctlJoin`, but I would think that is the most suspicious part of the story. I doubt it's a bug in the game itself (since I've played its ad hoc mode on real PSPs with other real PSPs), and the ad hoc server seems not to be implicated.

As a side note, manually decrementing that address by four bytes does align the group name properly, but then the emulator spins in these three calls until the player disconnects:

```
46:41:953 psx_main     I[NET]: HLE/sceNetAdhoc.cpp:2624 sceNetAdhocctlGetPeerList(0bff288c, 0bff28a0) at 08a1bcd4
46:41:970 psx_main     I[NET]: HLE/sceNetAdhoc.cpp:2624 sceNetAdhocctlGetPeerList(0bff320c, 00000000) at 08a1bc18
46:41:970 psx_main     I[NET]: HLE/sceNetAdhoc.cpp:2624 sceNetAdhocctlGetPeerList(0bff288c, 00000000) at 08a1bc18
```

Finally, I was concerned about a couple of places where buffers meant for/coming from packet transport are being assigned to other pointers instead of memcpy'd (lines 886, 1112, 1187). But changing those didn't seem to help anything, so I'm probably just misunderstanding your memory model. This is my first time looking at the code.
title: Final Fantasy Tactics: War of the Lions & Ad Hoc Play

body:
(Possibly related to https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/6057)

Issue is as stated in the title. First responsible commit found via bisecting is https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/commit/ecdffab by @unknownbrackets 

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3791774/9efa96a8-1b53-11e4-85c7-930ace70877b.PNG)

Last unaffected commit is 0.9.6-723-g4cec228 https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/commit/4cec228 by @unknownbrackets 

Savedata for issue reproduction:- 
![ulus10438datc00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3791776/d80adcb4-1b53-11e4-8474-f3c6af5197af.jpg)
(rename jpg to 7z and unzip using 7zip)

Issue reproduction:-

a. Start the game using any build from 0.9.6-724-gecdffab onwards with default settings.

b. Load the provided savefile.

c. Head to Pangya Tour Mode, then License, followed by Blue Lagoon and finally Chip-in.

d. Playthrough the short challenge, and when the Results (Success) screen comes up, try pressing the X button.

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3791818/5b76da2a-1b55-11e4-9843-dabea226a656.JPG)

e. One of two things will happen; you'll either hear the confirmation sound but the game will refuse to proceed onwards (spamming the X button will just produce the ding sound repeatedly but nothing else will happen), or the game (and PPSSPP) will just crash.

A proper debug logfile of the issue could not be obtained; the game/ppsspp would hang with a black screen when attempting to load a save file in order to reproduce the issue when Debug Logging to a file is active, which is probably another issue in itself. 

Here's what I managed to get until then:-
![ppsspplog pangya](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3791841/c437f3c2-1b56-11e4-8698-90ecd596fa75.jpg)
(rename jpg to 7z and unzip using 7zip)

The stacktrace obtained from the instances when the game/ppsspp crashed was also rather useless and only pointed to the disassembly.

Caveat:-

1. Happens even when Fast Memory is disabled.

Thanks to Nightquaker and the others in the ppsspp.org forums for the initial discovery of the issue.

body:
First "responsible" commit found via bisecting is https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/commit/a7b9ce205b6c43b52c71ebaf95f9bf599b4ccc50 by @unknownbrackets which enabled function replacements (FR) by default.

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3743136/b9f016f6-1773-11e4-9d47-eaa49929e4e1.PNG)

Last "unaffected" commit is https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/commit/986d54039c450faf8945c06ab1527b88db979cd7

(I am aware that the issue lies with FR itself and only remained asymptomatic in previous revisions due to FR not being exposed in the options and enabled, hence the quotation marks.)

Short video demonstration of the issue:-
https://www.mediafire.com/?w02nn5textr4qmk

Savedata for issue reproduction (rename jpg to 7z and unzip using 7zip):-
![ulus105400004](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4345150/3742814/4d940710-176e-11e4-9594-4d65297b2704.jpg)

Reproduction Method:-

1. Start the game using any revision from v0.9.8-1052-ga7b9ce2 onwards, ensuring that Simulate Block Transfers and Function Replacements are enabled.

2. Load the provided savedata.

3. Walk northwards (straight up).

4. Have a look at the minimap, and note that the arrow denoting your characters position is twitchy.

Caveats:-

1. Does not occur if either Simulate Block Transfers or Function Replacements is disabled. Incidentally, the game needs both options enabled for some of the advanced graphical effects to work with Buffered Rendering (e.g. the transparent status menu and save screenshots.)

2. Only occurs when using a particular in-game map orientation (as shown in the provided savefile)

3. Moving in other directions (west, east and south) does not elicit the issue.

Temporary Solutions:-

1. Disable function replacements in this game, which will result in the loss of certain other graphical functionality. (e.g. transparent status menu and savedata screenshot captures).

2. Alternatively, one of the 2 Read Framebuffers to Memory modes can be used to re-attain the lost graphical functionality (when FR's disabled) at heavily reduced performance. The arrow doesn't twitch when using those modes.
title: Legend of Heroes Trails in the Sky (ULUS10540) : Extremely twitchy character arrow marker in the minimap when moving/facing northwards with Function Replacements and Simulate Block Transfers enabled.

The same thing happens when you are switching between non and buffered rendering
1.Start any game and go ingame
2.Switch to non-buffered=>make something to switch to another screen(enter another are or menu)=>switch to buffered rendering

From now on when switching between normal and full screen,you will see for a half a second the screen on which you enabled buffered rendering.

Project DIVA- extend - wait for the video to start,then skip it,open the ge debugger=>press Step Frame and press F11 twice(you(at least it's not working here) can't use the debugger in full screen))or resize\maximize the window=>press Step Frame once or twice and you'll see the video.

Agarest Senki Mariage - same as above(rather than image from the video,you see weird screen)

Windows 7 x64 - v0.9.9-20-g45263fd - Loco Roco (UCUS98662)

Audio speed hack is turned off.
Simulate block transfer is turned off.
Buffered rendering is used with 5x PSP resolution.
No speedup options are enabled.
Fast memory and real clock sync are disabled.
title: Loco Roco 1 (and possibly 2)

title: PPSSPPSDL does not hide mouse pointer

body: PPSSPP does not inhibit xscreensaver from running. This can cause issues as xscreensaver will try to run over ppsspp, will fail to grab the screen and instead grab keys leaving the user in an awkward position trying to save and close PPSSP. A workaround is to kill xscreensaver before running PPSSPP and launching it again afterwards.
title: xscreensaver is not inhibited

body: When using a tiling window manager like [dwm](http://dwm.suckless.org/) ppsspp fails to resize the window when switching from fullscreen mode. A workaround is to swap from tiling to floating and then retile the window when swapping between fullscreen and tiled window mode. PPSSPP also will stay at the same resolution when in floating mode after being pulled out of fullscreen rather than going back to the original resolution of windowed mode.
title: PPSSPP doesn't resize with tiling window managers

body:
Some games can make use of the PSP's sleep mode for some extra benefits, like leveling up while the console is in low power mode. I only know of one game that uses it:

* Final Fantasy Type-0
* Idol Master SP

If you know of more games that use the sleep functionality of the PSP, please list them here. We can also discuss here how the system enters sleep mode. I wrote a 99% broken attempt at emulating the power switch: https://github.com/thedax/ppsspp/commit/4cffabfca889ca4efd7dffc46bb226fd153f07a6 (it's messy and uses a timer event to put the emulated PSP to sleep over 2 seconds or so, though that was just an arbitrary value I used). Most games ignore the event, and some hang forever, so I don't know the exact behaviour of how to put the entire emulated machine into sleep mode, yet.
title: Sleep mode/power switch functionality discussion

body:
Not to pile on with the slew of recent FF Type-0 issues, but I was wondering if anyone would have any ideas about this. I was grinding levels on the world map for about an hour, then cleared the Corsi Cave. After exiting the cave I was running my way back to the academy to save, when a battle triggered. But for some reason the screen went black during the transition and ppsspp was just hanging. So I exited and relaunched (luckily I had made a save state 30 sec before the issue occurred) and continued.

But now the same thing happens. Every time the game needs to transition screens or load a new area, ppsspp with go black screen and hang. The log console just gets bombarded with an infinite amount of "Memmapfunctions.cpp:92 readfromhardware invalid address" when this happens. I tried every combination of settings (MT and fast mem off, restoring default settings, tons of combos of things off and on, different ppsspp builds.) to no avail. 

If it was just a case of a save state getting corrupted then I wouldn't be too worried, but the hanging screen didn't start when I loaded the state, it started before that. Even though the normal save data lets me enter/exit screens it's a bit worrying not knowing what caused the issue to begin with because I have no idea if I'll end up grinding for an hour on the world map and getting stuck there unable to go back to save at the academy again....

On an unrelated note, the characters sometimes look graphically incorrect during world map battles no matter the rendering mode (they looked normal during the prologue mission though). They sometimes look like Metal Cap Mario from SM64 (I don't know how else to describe it lol) I think this could be related to LunaMoo's Type-0 graphic issue; when I've ran the GE Debugger I've gotten similar results as him/her.
title: FF Type 0 Invalid Address issue

body:
The now-infamous ending of the tutorial in FF : Type-0 appears to change the CLUT of all textures on every frame for a little while, causing us to create ridiculous amounts of textures (5000+), consuming hundreds of megs of VRAM.

I've been thinking about a way to "fix" it. For the below, keep in mind that texture cache keys are (address << 32 | clut_hash).

If the amount of textures created > some_threshold, flip to CLUT-checking mode.

In this mode, in TextureCache.cpp:SetTexture, before the big if (iter != cache.end()) check, insert an additional check that looks for textures with the same address but different CLUT (cache.lower_bound(cachekey & 0xFFFFFFF00000000ULL) , checking the key of the iter returned, should do the trick), and in that case, remove and insert the cache entry with the new cache key, ensuring that we re-decode the texture into the same texture object instead of creating a new one.

Then, after a couple of frames with none of those happening, switch back to regular mode.

@unknownbrackets , seems like this should work, right? We'll still have decoding overhead but little VRAM waste.
title: Rapidly changing CLUTs cause out-of-control texture creation - proposed solution

It's overall very hard to use (tested with a xbox360 controller)
IMO, navigation keys should follow Control Mapping settings: Dpad to move, O to confirm, X to go back (or swap O/X following "Confirmation button" settings in Settings - System - PSP settings)

**Can't use d-pad down / arrow down on keyboard**
Whenever I use it, it just takes me back to previous screen.
This makes most UI functions inaccessible with controller / keyboard.
The other three directions working fine.

**In-game pause menu**
If a save slot with no save data is highlighted when you open the pause menu, "Load state" won't become available if you switch to a slot with savedata LB/RB. (d-pad would work, but not very functional since d-pad down doesn't work as expected)

In most cases, it's better to use a mouse or touch screen (like tweaking settings) but it's definitely making more sense to access pause menu with a controller (of course if you're playing with one)

It is true that we can assign save/load/next slot to controller buttons, but on a xbox360 controller there are only 5 extra buttons and LT/RT can not be assigned to "next slot" function since it would be triggered multiple times on one press (definitely need work on those triggers) - well, won't be a problem for keyboard though, we have more than enough buttons to assign to any function we want.
title: UI navigation very hard (impossible in most cases) to use with a controller / keyboard

body:
**In short**: render 2D games with 1xPSP resolution then upscale the entire screen with xBRZ for better performance and better image quailty comparing to texture scaling

I've searched and found this has been discussed before in #1468, which is closed with the conclusion of using texture scaling. This has been working great for most 3D games with 3xBRZ with a acceptable performance drop when rendering new textures.

Recently I've been playing around trying to make some of my loved 2D games work with 3xBRZ texture scale without too much performance drop. During the process, I found 3xBRZ is quiet high-performance - it even scales a video at full speed (60/60 fps, scaling one 512x512 texture per two frames) while there is a huge performance drop in another game (17/30 fps, two 512x512 textures getting scaled per frame)

So I'm thinking what if we just render 2D games at 1x PSP resolution and pass every frame through xBRZ before bilinear (I'm talking about the bilinear scale while doing rendering resolution -> screen resolution)

480x272 comparing to 512x512 in pixels is about 50% less, plus we only need to do xBRZ once (at most) per frame, this sure will increase performance in most 2D games comparing to texture scaling (tell me I'm wrong) and this method would provide better image quality since some 2D games rendering large objects with multiple textures, scaling them separately will make some glitches at texture borders.

**Pros:**
1. Better performance since we only need to do upscale on a 480x272 image once (at most) per frame.
2. Better final image quailty since there's no more glitches on edges caused by upscale textures separately.

**Cons:**
1. More cpu usage since we lost the ability to cache scaled textures separately. Truth we can only cache the entire screen if it doesn't move at all (title screen, pause screen)
2. xBRZ performance may not be enough for some games running at 60 fps, especially on mobile device.

I've seen other emulators (like DeSmuME) supporting xBRZ on the entire screen and even 5xBRZ doesn't lead to a noticeable performance drop, how do they do it?
title: Feature Request: xBRZ on whole PSP screen (for 2D games)

body:
When playing games on 1080p display with 4xPSP resolution, the render resolution would be 1920x1088 then it would be resized to 1920x1080 with black borders on left and right side to keep aspect radio.

Currently, the only possible way to make game screen fill entire 1080p display is using Stretch to display, which isn't so noticeable since PSP resolution is very near 16:9. But there certainly is a better method: just crop the original screen (in this case, cut out 4 pixels on both top and bottom, 1088 -> 1080) to make it a true 16:9 resolution, then resize it (if necessary) to fill the display.

By this way, we would have game screen fill entire display and actually keep the aspect radio. If we're rendering at a proper resolution (eg: 4xPSP FHD, 8xPSP UHD) we would get 1:1 pixel mapping on a proper display.
title: Feature Request: Crop to display (1:1 pixel mapping)

body:
We've gotten an influx of new users thanks to the release of the translation patch and looking at various forum threads they're hitting the following pain points:

  * Texture scaling slows down unexpectedly much (perhaps they choose Auto? it really overdoes it) (IMPROVED)
  * Crashes due to multithreading:

    "Game keeps crashing at the same point for me, "This is recon, weve found one of the jammers" as soon as i walk to boss exe crashes (ppsspp latest build)
     edit: It seems multithreading caused it, turned that off :P"

  * Massive slowdowns at the end of the tutorials have been reported, not sure if related to texture scaling

Other bugs:

  * First (and second and probably more) cutscene after starting the game won't play (Android only, works on Windows)  (FIXED)

  * When having just defeated an enemy and when grabbing phantoma, the screen turns black for a second on Tegra.

  * Cracks in geometry + z-fighting on some hardware only

  * The Codex issue is a bug with the translation patch. Seems to usually work if you in-game save and load (not states). So not a bug in PPSSPP.

I think we need to change how we expose texture scaling in the interface. The slowdowns aren't as extreme anymore when texture scaling as I've added a hauristic that prevents more than a certain number of texels per frame to be scaled.
title: Final Fantasy Type-0 issues (texture scaling, MT crash)
