body:
(All codes locate in TextureCache.cpp)

Firstly, I've made a custom build which disabled texture change frequency check by comment out:

```c++
if (entry->numFrames < TEXCACHE_FRAME_CHANGE_FREQUENT) {
	entry->status |= TexCacheEntry::STATUS_CHANGE_FREQUENT;
}
```

It worked pretty fine for me on most 2D games since I'm running PPSSPP on a desktop computer which is powerful enough. But...

![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2091529/3211512/a9bff3b6-ef1c-11e3-94b3-51b9fe740ab4.jpg)

ULJS00251 - 密室のサクリファイス

When the OP movie ends and the title screen shows up I experienced a terrible framerate drop - on a static background title screen.

Then I'm wondering why I can scale the OP movie fine (every frame is decoded to a texture and scaled) but not the title screen, so I made more test found out that texture 0x09061400 (which is the background image) keeps getting a random hash, which I think is wrong since it's not changing at all.

So I reduced sizeInRAM to 1/4 of the original size by changing the code:

```c++
const u32 sizeInRAM = (textureBitsPerPixel[format] * bufw * h) / 8;
```

to (I'll explain why 1/4 not by half later)

```c++
const u32 sizeInRAM = (textureBitsPerPixel[format] * bufw * h) / 32;
```

![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2091529/3211514/a9e6318e-ef1c-11e3-9ab2-7be584c6b67f.jpg)

Then I got full speed (60/60 fps) on title screen.

![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2091529/3211510/a9b91f8c-ef1c-11e3-9f49-c657551937e5.jpg)

Here's the srceenshot for the texture in GE Debugger

![4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2091529/3211511/a9bc9cde-ef1c-11e3-91f6-b88cf773ad65.jpg)

NPJH50656 - それゆけ! ぶるにゃんマン Portable~とりもどせ! あいとせいぎときぼうのつにゃ缶~

Extreme framerate drop in save slot selecting scene.

![5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2091529/3211516/aa868c38-ef1c-11e3-9ca0-307824e354b5.jpg)

Reduced sizeInRAM to 1/4 of the original size helped (while 1/2 doesn't)

In this case, textures that causing the problem are 0x094609c0 and 0x0945c8c0 (screenshot below)

![6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2091529/3211513/a9c59d52-ef1c-11e3-8e8e-4c5f8cb182a0.jpg)
![7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2091529/3211515/a9f768f0-ef1c-11e3-8470-6cb2f3756e3a.jpg)

So I guess the problem is the sizeInRAM is too big for this texture which causes hashing wrong range of ram (larger than the texture acturally uses)

That's all I can do... I know little about programming so it will be nice if someone acturally knows how to find the correct sizeInRAM have a look into this.
title: sizeInRAM in QuickTexHash correct, but larger than usage for some textures

body: Requirements to reproduce: -Create a subdirectory in PSP\GAME. I'll call it "UMD0:\". -Get ProQuake 4.71: http://quakeone.com/proquake/proquake_471_psp.rar. Only EBOOT.PBP and m_bttns.lmp are necessary from the archive, the rest are just text and source code files. Extract EBOT.PBP in UMD0:\ and m_bttns.lmp in UMD0:\ID1\GFX creating the missing directories. -Get the PAK0.PAK and PAK1.PAK from the original PC version and put them in UMD0:\ID1. -Put the save file from here in UMD0:\ID1. Load the game, pick up the rune and quickly hide from Chthon attack. Chthon will keep striking the other side of the wall with explosions causing the glitch. This glitch doesn't happen on JPCSP. The log console doesn't show any warnings. If I turn on Anti-Aliasing in-game it reduces the glitch a bit but it causes small screen shaking.
title: ProQuake 4.71 small glitches when rendering explosions

body:
I've said about this issue in Blazing Souls Accelate comment, but as it have nothing to do with that issue I thought it desires for separated issue. Hadn't found it mentioned anywhere else, so I've tried to pinpoint build from which it all began.
v.0.9.8-357 working flawless.
v.0.9.8-365 video became the way it is now(though not exactly as there was swapped color channels in that build, but speed-wise exactly like there).

Issue - in multiple games video from perfect became slow, choking.
The ones I've tried - Dissidia Final Fantasy (ULUS10437), Fate/Tiger Colosseum Upper (ULJM05360), Lord of Arcana (ULUS10479), R-Type Command (ULUS10343), Tenchu: Shadow Assassins(ULUS10419) and the game I'm always checking if it started to work properly - Blazing Souls: Accelate (ULUS10527). Could be easily seen in intros and other movies in those games.

Note that same kind of issue present in SoulCalibur: Broken Destiny (ULUS10457), but it's not appearing on 365 it starts at 544 and last version without issue was 531.

As there's a gap with no builds by buildbot between 357 an 365, here's changelog(including 365):
-Merge: 7ef2678 c7aafadMerge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' into Universal_Audio_Branch
-Fix wrong stretch in Wildarm XF (non-buffered mode)
-Fix texture cache invalidation.
-Add #extension GL_EXT_shader_framebuffer_fetch : require
-Avoid unbinding the current fbo on block transfer.Improves God of War performance by 25% (at least in the demo.)
-Optimize the case of a direct byte copy.Small improvement (like 3.5%) in God of War.
-Interpret iForceMaxEmulatedFPS based on 1.001 NTSC.
-Merge: dc0eea0 ed99c33Merge pull request #5877 from unknownbrackets/gpu-minorImprove God of War performance
-Merge: 4eedd7a e8d0cc6Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' into Universal_Audio_Branch
-Support sceMp3LowLevel*Gundam G custom BGM is supported now :)
-Merge: 35a31cd ca6e463Merge pull request #5873 from unknownbrackets/texcacheFix texture cache invalidation...
-correct some comments.
-more cleanup
-Use GL_BGRA for 32 bit textures on Windows.25% improvement in Popolocrois, probably decent gains in other games using32-bit textures often. FF2 for example doesn't.
-implement sceMp3GetFrameNum
-Merge: a285d04 943353fMerge pull request #5874 from unknownbrackets/texcache2Use GL_BGRA for 32 bit textures on Windows.

Changelog between 531 and 544 including 544:
-Move POWER_VMEM_IN_USE to sceKernel.h
-Let desktop SDL builds see the fullscreen option, too. There's no reason they can't.
-Merge: 4eb7991 ed6ea61Merge pull request #5979 from unknownbrackets/multithreadFix deadlock in multithreading
-Merge: 56018fb e61a151Merge pull request #5964 from raven02/patch-26Add Vertex texture/color GE commands
-Merge: a799941 27fbf4cMerge pull request #5977 from unknownbrackets/psmfplayerFix video flicker, add memchecks and detect no audio better
-Merge: 7fd8404 21e4dc6Merge pull request #5973 from raven02/patch-30Move POWER_VMEM_IN_USE to sceKernel.h.

I know it's kinda late, it's already 594, but still hope that helps.
title: Multiple games slow, choking video (texture scaling + lazy hashing applied!)

body: There are plenty of performance regressions in this game surprisingly appeared and amplified progressively during alpha test optimizations! Initial system configuration: ![screen00000](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1138235/1827284/57ba9a3c-722e-11e3-86e1-c57c3494f771.jpg) Current system configuration: ![menu_00000](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1138235/2541700/dabc48be-b5df-11e3-9678-a86b062902a5.jpg) 1. Zus are fading slower than other monsters. Here is a game save data to reproduce. Select The After Years game, load file 6 and wander around for a bit, the chance to encounter Zus frequently in the area is high. It can only be noticed on laptops with low frequency CPUs. 2. Audio shutter which occurs while game menus are on screen has gone worse. Can still workaround by setting frameskip to 1 or higher. It can only be noticed on laptops with low frequency CPUs. 3. Audio shutters happens in some dungeons even while no game menu is on screen, notably in Passage of Eidolons. Here is game save data to reproduce. Select The After Years game and load file 6. It can only be noticed on laptops with low frequency CPUs.
title: Performance regressions in FF4 CC

Hello there.
I've got a problem that really bugs me since over a week and I couldn't find a real solution to it...

I am playing Persona 3 Portable on the PPSSPP v0.9.7.2, so the newest model.
Every now and then the game makes my AMDDrive crash and the screen on the PPSSPP went black as well as the audio stops playing. It occures in 4 different situations and in different locations and to different times.

1. During Conversations with other characters (mostly when I give gifts to them and the notes come up)
2. During exploration of Tartarus when I ran across the map searching for enemies. It does not make a difference if I rotate the view or not.
3. During the attempt of catching a Shadow off guard (meaning I strike at it)
4. During battle - It happens with normal attacks, Persona summon magic and items like "Jack Brothers".

My system is as followed:

Prozessor - Intel (R) Core(TM)2 Duo CPU E8500 @ 3.16 GHz
RAM - 4,00 GB (3,19 GB)
System type - 32bit
Graphic Card - ATI Radeon HD 4800 (newest Drive)
Audio Card - AMD High Definition Audio Device & Realtek High Definition Audio

My PPSSPP configuration are now back to standart, but I already tried many of the suggestions posted on the net... It sometimes enables me to play a few hours longer, but crashes after a while still...

I would really apprechiate if someone could help me solve this problem somehow.

body:
Another one about Macross ~
 Water animation is just choppy in all 3 macross games it seems to change texture once every exactly 10 frames and it seems to show single texture which seems to be additionally incorrect.

 My thought on how it tries to work:
 The game is running at 30fps and there are 3 water textures, I don't understand all it tries to do, but the order of the 3 water textures does change every 10 frames by looking at GE debugger and it probably should blend/mix them to give a nice smooth water animation. In ppsspp the first texture is clearly visible, the other two which are processed after never affect the screen in any way until their turn comes after 10 frames.

 Tried all hacks and optional settings for it from the graphics tab, nothing seems to affect it, including software renderer.

 Not sure if this is related, but before v0.9.7.1-37-g9c4d946(Detect bad mipmap sizes, autogen mipmaps in this case.), we had to disable mipmaps to even see the water, it's animation was always choppy like that through.

 Here are the pictures of the 3 water textures in GE debugger, the first one is the one ending up visible on the screen with the second one, if you look at the 3rd one it should be affected by the second texture already, but still shows only the first one.
title: Macross water animation problem

body:
MHP3rd HD gives the error 'GPUCommon.cpp:768 RET: Stack empty!'  many times per frame.

![ge](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1079662/2242991/f2c16640-9d18-11e3-92e6-a4236c25bec9.png)
Here are 2 Bases in a row which makes no sense.  Below that is a couple bone data structures with the common
Bone data*12
Ret
format.  The flow through the bone data structures is what causes the spam.

![dis1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1079662/2242993/fd365b9e-9d18-11e3-9120-cad2842a4d94.png)

This is the first place where the 2 base sequence is touched.  Blue underline is the first base and Red is the second base.
This actually sets the pair to
Base 0x000000
Jmp 0x000000

Later on in the same function, unconditionally:
![dis2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1079662/2242996/0277e5aa-9d19-11e3-96b3-9c70fada050e.png)
Blue and red are as before and purple is used for both.
This shared section sets v0 to 0x10000000 | (t9 >> 8) & 0x00ff0000
where t9 points to the command after the bone structures (and s5 aliases 0x4(s2))

This looks pretty strongly to be a bug in the game itself and not of ppsspp.

As this is an HD rerelease it is quite possible that the game never worked on an actual psp.

It would be nice if someone has the original MHP3rd and can check whether it gives the same error.

It would also be nice if someone who knows how to write display lists can make a test for what a ret on an empty stack does on a real psp.
title: MHP3rd HD RET: Stack empty error

There's a problem affecting potentially quite a few/all Artdink games as most of them(all?) seems to be about robots and run on same engine. Basically during some animations certain model parts seems to be disrupted/stretched and stand out in an ugly&weird way:

 Just to be sure I tried JIT on/off as well as software mode, it wasn't affecting the problem in any way. Also as far as I checked Macross games, the problem existed from the very first builds it could go in-game.

body:
I'm opening this issue to let you know that there are some odd behaviour within the game. When you select some moves and attack with them some animations seems to be skipped (further info in this post http://forums.ppsspp.org/showthread.php?tid=9462&pid=75237#pid75237). I believe the issue is caused by some .pmf files. I know that a user time ago did a fix which involved a software called DNRiper and some steps to follow in order to show these skipped animation through JPCSP. What I find interesting is that JPCSP still show that animation, even if corrupted, while PPSSPP simply skip it until the second part of the animation is shown. I know that my explanation is kinda confusing, so if you need further info about this let me know. For those interested in the issue, here are some useful files:

DNRiper Fix: http://www.sendspace.com/file/rkhlni

A savedata for the game: http://www.sendspace.com/file/ru8bl2
title: Super Robot Taisen OG Saga: Masou Kishin II - Revelation of Evil God movies/moves skipped

body:
Related to the original feature request here, https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/5477 and the pull request implemented here, https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/pull/5479

Log Levels in a Release build are now by default set to "Info" since https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/pull/5479 was merged to master, which is perfectly normal and non-detrimental to performance. Most users will be logging in this mode, unless explicitly instructed to produce a full debug by a developer.

Changing it to "Debug" in order to view the full Debug Log works as expected (you get the fast moving log spam as a result, with all of its verbosity) but the kicker is that the change to the global setting itself is not saved after you exit the emulator. 

Which means that one has to continuously change it to "Debug" everytime in between sessions. It'd be nice to make the global Log Level settings (and indeed the individual ones too) save an entry in ppsspp.ini which can be transfered in between sessions.

I checked the ppsspp.ini file for any references to the Log Levels and I couldn't find any.

Thanks for your time.
title: PPSSPP:- Log Levels not saved in between sessions.

body: Since 2x rendering resolution is often too demanding for Android devices, while 1x plays much smoother but (especially on tablets) it's very low-res, I think it might be a good idea to have more rendering resolution options (for example by steps of x0.5, like 1x, 1.5x, 2x, 2.5x, 3x and so on) in order to have at least a 1.5x resolution option that could suit best the compromise between video quality and speed.
title: [Enhancement] more rendering resolution settings (Android)

body:
I'm surprised nobody has reported this yet, but it's been afflicting this game since at least June or July of 2013, so a precise range of builds is not really possible. I haven't seen reports of this happening before then, however. @solarmystic: do you know if this problem existed back in the 0.7 or 0.7.5 days, or even earlier?

Basically what happens is both fighters' legs will move back and forth on their own in a glitchy manner when they're idle, and not being moved by the player/AI. It's especially noticable if one goes into practice mode and pushes the opponent up against the wall.

Steps for reproduction:
1. Start Tekken 6.
2. Enter practice mode.
3. Pick any two characters, and push the CPU opponent against the wall.
4. Observe the trembling/twitching/"flickering".

I tested with 0.9.6-881-g8c63f38, Windows x64. No combination of Vertex Caching, HW transform, texture scaling, buffered/unbuffered rendering, Jit on/off, Fast Memory on/off, SoftGPU, etc., fixes it.

What should I look for in the GE Debugger?

SoftGPU testing isn't an option; the game is completely broken graphically in it:
![Screenshot 01](http://i.minus.com/ibzusMeNgPZXd5.jpg)

Here's a video of the problem:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BwcSjM-JLvbkX2VKM1NhOTVtQmc/edit?usp=sharing
title: Tekken 6 (ULUS10466): Fighters' legs tremble/shudder/"flicker" in battle

this is a rather strange problem i'm experiencing with my moga pro in HID mode.
when a D-pad button and either an analog stick or gas/throttle(L/R2) button are mapped to the same psp button the game will only respond to the D-pad.

this causes problems in games like phantasy star and monster hunter when you want to go through menus with the D-pad and control the camera with the right analog stick.

problem occurs on build 0.9.6-736(latest right now) and older.
D-pad blocks use of the following buttons when mapped to the same control:
right analog, left analog, L2(Brake), and R2(throttle/gas).
title: pressure sensitive buttons are ignored when a D-pad button is mapped to the same psp button (Moga)

body:
I have a tablet with  a 7 inch display and when I enable the option small display the part displayed is really too small (I think it's less than 3 inch), so at the moment it is pretty much useless.
It would be great to have a "medium" screen option or even better an option to resize the screen.
This option would be very useful on Android to speed up non-buffered rendering (due to its fixed resolution, enabling the small display option there's a huge speed boost, but as I said it's not much useful since the area displayed is really too small)
Having more option for resizing could give the possibility to better suit system specification with displayed area.
title: With "small display" option enabled the screen is too small (Android)

body:
![notitle](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1138235/1849564/58ae30f6-76b7-11e3-9706-b6264987bfc1.png)

Initial requirements: 
-have at least a game ISO or demo/homebrew that contains an internal name (ex. ProQuake) in memstick\PSP\GAME;
-wipe recent games list or remove ppsspp.ini (wiping recent games list is enough to reproduce). 
Steps to reproduce:
-Wait for a new revision (required, it doesn't reproduce if you rewind your current branch repository head);
-Launch PPSSPP from repository manually or from VS2013 (doesn't seam to matter, also doesn't matter if you build the new PPSSPP revision or not), switch to homebrew / demos tab and witness the issue (PPSSPP will show the filename of the ISO file instead of it's internal name). 

Workarounds: Switch homebrew/demos to grid view and back to list view or restart PPSSPP.
Moving the executable. assets, flash0, lang and memstick folders to another location doesn't help.
Issue reproducing is certain for 32-bit Windows.
As per @ufdada's suggestion, here is a screenshot of the game details (the information is exact, but if I click 'Back' I get back to the state from screenshot above):   
![screen00000](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1138235/1851163/fdeb2890-76e3-11e3-8506-57eb5ecd8f62.jpg)
title: PPSSPP cannot read the game title showing the filename instead under rare circumstances

body:
SDL version is almost complete,  the only missing piece is Fullscreen toggle feature. Save and Load also work great, just a toggle fullscreen will make it extremely useful.

Please consider adding "Toggle Fullscreen" Shortcut in SDL version - say F11. 

Starting with --fullscreen will not let us toggle to window or 2x mode.

Advantages:
1. Overcome Hangup: In Linux, if SDL hangs in fullscreen we can't do anything except to reset the computer :(, so switching to window mode would make the system shortcuts work again.

2. Sound Quality: SDL version has better quality sound, qt4 and qt5 both are not good with sound quality.

3. Autobuild becomes useful: auto build git version for linux only builds SDL, so SDL could be used easily by every linux distro easily, without needing Qt libraries.

Thanks.
title: PPSSPPSDL - needs Toggle Fullscreen Shortcut

Not sure how feasible this is for a PSP emulator, but I've noticed that Dolphin has a FIFO player, which seems to allow the emulator to dump almost everything that's going on, graphics wise, into a file, and can then play it back on another computer, even if the developer or person using the file doesn't have the game.

Could such a feature be useful for PPSSPP?

Note that I'm not volunteering to write it, that's way beyond me. It's merely an idea.

body:
PPSSPP has made huge leaps recently in the debugging department thanks to great contributions by @Kingcom and @unknownbrackets (#2584, #3366).

I'm opening this meta-issue to discuss what improvements could be made to make it even *awesomer*.
+ What is your use case of bps, mem bps, ge bps?
+ What feels the most usable, or conversely needs rework?

Feel free to input your opinion below.

Here is the current state of the Breakpoint Window:
> ![Breakpoint Dialog](http://i.imgur.com/XEqRnIO.png)

# 1 - Improvements to breakpoints (logging, etc.)
Log breakpoints are not a specific type of breakpoint, rather it is a breakpoint which **triggers an action**, which is logging an expression.
They offer the choice to **not enter debug mode** when hit.

Let's review what options are offered in other debuggers:

+ OllyDbg 1.x:
OllyDbg offers to execute diverse actions depending on whether a condition is fulfilled, etc. It can also cast the logged expression to a struct/string/etc. pointer for proper display.

![Log bp in OllyDbg 1](http://i.imgur.com/yNcHGDO.png)

+ OllyDbg 2.x:
OllyDbg  goes a bit further, removes support for plugin (temp?) and is able to log several expressions

![Log bp in OllyDbg 2 ss1](http://i.imgur.com/C4GiUdl.png)
![Log bp in OllyDbg 2 ss2](http://i.imgur.com/gAAmoaf.png)

+ Visual Studio:
VS has more basic logging, but being a source-based debugger, can support symbols as well.

![Log bp in VS2010 ss1](http://i.imgur.com/jhYePuB.png)
![Log bp in VS2010 ss2](http://i.imgur.com/WdZoTRl.png)

### Actions
- Add a textedit for an expression. When bp is hit & conditions are met (in pseudo-language)

``if bp.expr.valid(): log(expr.eval(currMIPS))``

- Add a checkbox to continue execution

- Take screenshot on bp?


# 2 - Enhancements to memory view

- Have the memory view set viewport at a particular expression (e.g. a1+4) when bp is hit

- Keep navigation stack so you can return to a previous location instead of typing it again.

- Right-click on location => in contextual menu, offer option to **set or modify a memory bp** / dump with this location as base address / **highlight** (change background color)

- location under cursor to be interpreted with **base conversion** (8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit). Detect if it is an address pointing to a code / variable section

- select range (mouse selection or R-click, select x bytes from here) and ability to **copy / dump selection**, may be useful for tile extractors? Offer **inline string decoding** options (e.g. display converted SJIS)

- Enable more interactions with the symbols list?

### Actions
- Add a textedit for an expression. When bp is hit & conditions are met, update memory view

# Mockup

![mockup](http://i.imgur.com/VJBi6ga.png)

# Other improvements

- Auto-load (auto-save?) Map symbols

- Remember bps when emulator is restarted

- Label breakpoints / comment field?

- how to handle memory bps when a system library writes into a buffer? (no break currently)

Sorry if it looks like a wishlist of mine... Also, I do not use the Ge debugger so can't comment on it.
title: Discussing Breakpoint improvements

body:
Tile based renderers like Mali and PowerVR can do super-cheap MSAA per tile (thus, doesn't require a final resolve like on PC) using this extension:

GL_EXT_multisampled_render_to_texture

http://www.khronos.org/registry/gles/extensions/EXT/EXT_multisampled_render_to_texture.txt

We could add support for that pretty easily.

For multisampling on PC we have to write a bit more complicated code and keep track of two FBOs for every framebuffer. Not super difficult, but a bit more work.
title: Feature: Cheap multisampling on TBRs

body:
But not as L2 and R2 of course because PSP doesn't have them. Instead, have them as Extra 1 and Extra 2. This way multiple buttons can be set to each of those buttons without having them be the exact same as L and R. Hopefully a maximum of 3 each.

The goal here is to bring back the L2 and R2 buttons that most capcom fighters are missing that were ported to the psp. For example, with this, I will be able to have the PPP and KKK (for darkstalkers or sf for example) buttons as two of my shoulders while still having different functionality with the 'original' L and R shoulders. 


As for Xinput trigger deadzones, what those are is the ability to tell the program at which pressure should the triggers be indicated as pressed.
For example: Trigger.Deadzone = 128 would mean that both triggers won't activate until it is pressed half way down. Trigger.Deadzone = 254 would mean that they button is considered pressed when it is fully pulled down. What this would do is help with precision for fighting games since triggers are not very good for them. With this, I will be able to slide a piece of cardboard down the back of the trigger, to adjust the maximum travel distance of the trigger (aka, basically turning the triggers back into shoulder buttons like PS2 and below).

To not use those cardboard pieces on the controller, I would like to request this extra bit (I don't know if it's possible or not but you let me know about this part):

Trigger.Deadzone.Press = 10
Trigger.Deadzone.Release = 240

If you know how to detect if the trigger is being pressed separately from if the trigger is being released, I would like for this to be added as extra. Trigger.Deadzone.Press = 10 would mean that the trigger is considered pressed when slightly pulling the trigger but is considered not pressed (released) when you slightly release it (numbers after the = sign would be user defined values of 0-255). When in gaming situations where you have to press a button rapidly, this will prevent the trigger not activating when pressing it again if you didn't fully release it. This is the main problem with Triggers and Fighting games.

These trigger options would be found under 'Game Settings > Controls > Trigger Options'.
title: [Feature Request] Add 2 Custom Button Slots and Xinput Trigger Deadzones

http://youtu.be/EYxacCerBbY
title: Async sound and blackscreen flashes in background videos (tested with Dj Max 2)

body:
Issue is as stated in the title. Responsible commit found via bisecting is https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/commit/8d00ab61e3b5974e38afec92e4f07453008c5a9c

The internal FPS during video playback before that commit was 60, which was correct:-

![60fps](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4345150/1025632/54d9f7ce-0e4a-11e3-8728-86363385207f.JPG)

After the commit https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/commit/8d00ab61e3b5974e38afec92e4f07453008c5a9c was merged to master in v0.9.1-41-g65e4d76 https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/commit/65e4d76543b7310ba63bb0b8742d753dc6dcc417, the internal FPS during video playback dropped to 45:-

![45fps](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4345150/1025633/590354ee-0e4a-11e3-966b-1fcc57b4e5ed.JPG)

Apparently merging the commit also happens to cause a whole host of other video related issues in other games as well (like Persona 3 and others) as related here https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/commit/65e4d76543b7310ba63bb0b8742d753dc6dcc417 in the comments section and in the forums.

Temporary solution:-

a. Resize the screen manually (via switching back and forth between full screen and windowed, or playing around with the 1x,2x,3x options) and the FPS will jump back to 60 during the video playback in the affected builds. Until the next CG playback of course.

![capture](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4345150/1025638/ac5172e8-0e4a-11e3-9361-baf7375e1c3a.JPG)

b. Reverting that commit restores the earlier working behaviour. Apparently this game needs the line that was deleted from the source file for proper FMV playback.
title: Project Diva 2nd (ULJM05681):- Incorrect Internal FPS when rendering the opening CG since v0.9.1-36-g8d00ab6

body:
From reporting:
http://report.ppsspp.org/logs/kind/94?status=any

This has happened in a number of games, a total of 1290 times.  That means it's not relatively common, although it's not likely to be a device glitch.  The majority of addresses are 0, but it's not clear how they are coming in.

The most likely paths are:
1. An enqueued list with this invalid PC.  This might mean a failing allocation.
2. A bad signal return.  Currently, those are unchecked.
3. Something causing the game to go haywire.
4. A game intentionally enqueuing pc=0 for behavior we don't currently support (unlikely?)

I only have two of the games it has occurred in, and I'm not sure how to repro.  It hasn't happened in those games recently.

In order of frequency, it has been reported most in:
 * 無双OROCHI２ Special
 * 碧の軌跡 (appears to have mem alloc problems.)
 * 金色のコルダ２ f
 * 討鬼伝　アクション体験版 (Toukiden demo)
 * Testdrive Unlimited ULET v3580
 * 真・三國無双6 Special

If anyone has any of the games this happens in, and can reproduce the issue, a log showing what happened before this error would be helpful.

-[Unknown]
title: Invalid DL PC on InterpretList

body:
I know that the keys is hard codes as "go back" but on 0.9.1-134 x86 is doing two things
1.The key is not set as a pause hotkey but it does bring the ingame menu.
2.Pressing it once while ingame,bring the ingame menu,and pressing it the second time while you are in the ingame menu(not is some sub menu),it quickly resumes the game and shows the menu again...you could say that you can't exit the menu with that key because it's resuming the game and then pause it again on KeyUp
KeyDown - resume
KeyUp - pause

Key Hold - switching extremely fast between the game and the ingame menu

title: Mytran wars freezes at intro

body:
The jit, to detect when the game modifies its code, writes "emuhack" instructions over the original MIPS instructions.  This way, if it's changed from an emuhack, we know that the code has likely been rewritten, and we need to recompile it.  It also makes it faster since the emuhack tells us where the jitted code is.

However, this only works because virtually all games just run MIPS code, they don't read it themselves.  Metal Gear Solid: Peace Walker demo actually hashes its own code, and then (it seems intentionally) goes into an infinite loop because it doesn't match.

The interpreter works fine since it doesn't need the emuhacks.

We should collect any other games with similar behavior here.

 * Metal Gear Solid: Peace Walker demo:
    Happens at 0x09C92818 or 08CCD80C when v1 == 00003119 (which reads from 0x09C92818.)

    Can be worked around by changing 0x0880FAE4 to 0A203F39 (j 0x0880FCE4), skipping the hash compare.

-[Unknown]
title: Jit funny business being detected (Metal Gear Solid: Peace Walker demo)

body:
See https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/3128#issuecomment-26065253

UPDATE:- With the source file change proposed by @unknownbrackets https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/3126#issuecomment-22468746, the game goes further ingame, and doesn't crash after choosing the New game options in the main menu. It now has 4 major unresolved issues left.https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/3128#issuecomment-22983569

Thanks to @unknownbrackets https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/pull/3126 pull request that got merged into master https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/commit/66569b8e59db3857ea76f4735e4fb24daa8f304b, this game, which has never booted up successfully on any previous build of PPSSPP now starts right up, generates an autosave successfully and plays back the rather "fun" opening FMV beautifully:-

(This is one of the most inoffensive SFW screenshots I could get from the FMV)

![capture](http://i4.minus.com/ilGCEQnkZFADJ.JPG)

Which then progresses to the title screen:-

![capture](http://i.minus.com/ibsUltVV2Xr45I.JPG)

Pressing start then brings us to this main menu:-

![doap4](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4345150/944834/d1db6a20-02e0-11e3-84f2-114f110d3aee.JPG)

Unfortunately, selecting any option in the aforementioned menu just leads to an infinite, non-progressive "Now Loading" screen or just a black screen, effectively hanging the game:- 

![capture](http://i.minus.com/ibdNsTgf8VKRMq.JPG)

Logfile up to the point it hangs:-

https://gist.github.com/solarmystic/6207386

Logfile from a debug build of the same revision (35 MB, in a 7z file):-

http://www.mediafire.com/?aj9ydcac9lsz9cl

No stacktrace is obtainable since the game doesn't actually crash the emulator at any point, and you can safely exit back to the main PPSSPP main menu screen even when the game hangs.

body:
I am aware that you guys are aware of these issues, but since I'm guessing it happens with every game, it's no longer adequate to call it "Square Games issues" like I did in #2065. Which I just closed, since the main issues in it were fixed as of 0.8.1.749.

By the way, Congratulations on that! :)

Now, the only issues left are:

* Some Texture Alignment issues when the rendering resolution is not 1X and if Anti-Aliasing is off.

![ccissues](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4536138/844700/1b03c840-f3d8-11e2-9eec-d70d6b08ccee.jpg)
This shows up the issue very well. At 2xH you can see a little line near Infantryman, and at 3xB you can see several issues.

* Speaking of the Texture Scaling, it only works when I enable it from the dropdown menu. If I go to the "Emulation Paused > Settings > Graphics" it won't work.

* Render Resolution won't work when you fullscreen or when you resize the window. It'll always assume the Window Size as the Render Resolution.

The problem is, when you fullscreen, it'll assume your desktop size as the rendering size, and my PC ain't all that powerful to handle everything I turn on.

A solution I got for this one is Saving State, then quitting the game, then leaving fullscreen, then pressing Ctrl+1 (or whatever setting I want the emulator to keep) then entering fullscreen again (what makes the menu drastically reduce its button sizes) then clicking to reopen the game, then loading the saved state.

This needs to be done everytime I need to do something else, what includes Alt+Tabbing.

Those 3 issues are now the only ones I'm having.
title: Texture Scaling Alignment & Render Resolution

[Continued from this thread: http://forums.ppsspp.org/showthread.php?tid=4644]
[Also continued from this issue: https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/2027
Started a new one as the previous one was confronting a different problem that's now obsolete]

I've tried now with v0.8.1-632-g05dfd27 and v0.8.1-633-g6cc141a, things are not fixed as of yet either.
Loading a savegame still crashes the emulator same as going through the intro again, and crashes before entering the Ruins area.
What's different from previous versions is that the colours are more vibrant now, and they look more closer to how they are on a real PSP. Also something that's changed, but not in good is that when the HUD is displayed on-screen, the game slows down by 10-20VPS, still playable (at least in the intro). This also happens when there are more than 3 peeps on-screen. I'm not sure if this is actually how the emu behaves or because I still had to limit the CPU frequency to 80 (to be able to pass through the FMV at the beginning). Also the text seems to flicker and morph a lot on the screen (turning into a lower-res font and back). This flicker happens almost constantly with punctuation from what I observed.
title: Innocent Life - Crashes the emulator when starting a new game or loading a save.

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1980487/690911/6906e262-db4a-11e2-9d52-6db870b3790c.jpg)
![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1980487/690906/95871470-db49-11e2-880a-6f20d8cddb8e.jpg)
The UI appears to give the dakuten and handakuten characters their own character space, which is incorrect behavior

Dakuten and Handakuten are the circle and " markings you see on some Japanese characters

Like the " in "gi" -> ギ
Or the circle in "pa" -> パ

To reproduce the problem: put the characters ギ and/or パ in a filename and view it in PPSSPP.

Dakuten and Handakuten display properly in the PPSSPP pause screen.

EDIT: Screenshot attached. 「コードギアス 反逆のルルーシュ LOST COLORS」 is the title.
title: Strange behavior with Japanese dakuten and handakuten characters (examples ギ、パ)

body:
In Phantasy Star Portable 2 US there's a few bugs but they don't appear everywhere. First the one cutting the feet of the characters when camera is default.
![image](http://img854.imageshack.us/img854/1032/legscutdefaultcamera.png)

When camera looks downwards the whole body is cut off.
![image](http://img194.imageshack.us/img194/7905/wholebodycutcameradownw.png)

When camera looks upwards the whole body is showing.
![image](http://img545.imageshack.us/img545/6528/fullbodynocut.png)
 
Also if you look closely, not only the body is cut off, but parts of the background too, light-like effects and transparent hologram-like screen don't show on default and downwards camera. And the door appears sometimes and sometimes it doesn't.

When in complete upwards looking camera position everything is displayed (it seems) but as soon as you move the camera just an inch up a lot of the background disappears.

---------

Some Background Objects only appear when close to them  which is wrong. (notice the bug in the font, the "i" are too thin, and spacing is wrong)
![image](http://img7.imageshack.us/img7/948/tappear.png)
![image](http://img543.imageshack.us/img543/3953/crystalappears.png)

---------
Also, photon weapons should be tranparent but they're not, they're also missing their glow (you know the glow that hovered over the characters quite a few revisions back)
Also weapons are not drawn correctly when a character is behind.
![image](http://img35.imageshack.us/img35/875/weapongoesthroughchars.png)

--------

There are no errors in Debug Log, except the issue I mentioned there : https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/issues/1785

Get this fixed and a lot of the game will be playable as now as of 0.7.6 - 547 there are character portraits and game is running pretty well, and I CAN LOAD MY PSP CHARACTERS FINE !!
title: [Graphics, OGL && D3D] [Phantasy Star Portable 2 US][x64] Draw distance, draw priority bugs, and transparency.

body:
After some experiments i managed to get some PSP remasters at least show something. :D 

Dialog message from Shin Sangoku Musou - Multi Raid 2 HD [NPJB-40003]
http://rghost.net/45500313/image.png

Ingame from K-ON Houkago Live HD [NPJB-40002]
http://rghost.net/private/45499838/86e3a668a65543ec3a05c75cee37176c 

Unfortunately due to lack of mine coding skills this method needs improvements. Ok, how it works:
Core/MemMap.h
- line 67, " inline u32 PSP_GetUserMemoryEnd()  { return 0x0B800000;} "
according to http://www.ps3devwiki.com/wiki/Emulation#PSP_HD_Remasters max. size of RAM, which is used in Eiyuu Densetsu Sora no Kiseki FC Kai HD Edition is 0x03000000 (another remasters using 0x02800000)
- line 103, " RAM_SIZE        = 0x4000000, "

Unfortunately, just those changes isn't enoght, and i got error messages with allocating additional memory. Log - http://rghost.net/45501037

As temporary solution to avoid this i done changes below. I know, it's wrong, but at least it do the trick with few remasters.
Core/MemmapFunctions.cpp
else if ((address & 0x3E000000) != 0x08000000)

Thanks in advance! :)
title: (PoC) Gettings PSP Remasters running

I would like to point out that identifiers like "[```_MEMMAP_H```](https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/blob/cf2a1dd3d20a12597c474a0d3f468b00e8b892c5/Core/MemMap.h#L18)" and "[```_JIT_ABI_H_```](https://github.com/hrydgard/ppsspp/blob/64cc57370386d28bdeab2854682498f1553266f0/Common/ABI.h#L18)" [do not fit](https://www.securecoding.cert.org/confluence/display/cplusplus/DCL32-CPP.+Do+not+declare+or+define+a+reserved+identifier#DCL32-CPPDonotdeclareordefineareservedidentifier-NoncompliantCodeExampleHeaderGuard "Do not use identifiers that are reserved for the compiler implementation.") to the expected naming convention of the C++ language standard.
Would you like to adjust your selection for unique names?
title: reserved identifier violation

body:
I found this idea in the reviews on Google Play: 

We could add integrated Dropbox or Google Drive support for easy save synchronization between your phone and your PC. That way you can start playing a PSP game on your computer, and then just keep playing where you were on your Android phone on the subway to work, for example, without having to manually copy saves around.

This would primarily apply to real proper game saves as they are small, but bandwidth is so good these days even on mobile that it's possible to imagine that save states could be synced as well. Need to be very careful with versioning for states though.
title: Cloud Saves

http://www.opengl.org/wiki/Vertex_Array_Object#Vertex_Array_Object

VAO is an extension to OpenGL ES 2.0 (and standard in ES 3.0 and desktop GL) and may provide the vertex cache with an additional speed boost.

Just adding it here so I don't forget about it, I'll do it one of these days.
